texts.en: Dr. Andrew O. is a general practitioner managing his own private health facility in Kisumu, Kenya.  He is 43 years old and lives with his wife and six school-aged children.  Dr. O. was employed by the government for the first three years of his career.  He then worked at a private hospital for six years before starting his own practice in 1997.  He ran his health facility on a part-time basis using it primarily for admissions, while his main practice remained in the center of town.  He gradually focused his efforts on building a larger out-patient facility as a part of this practice, and eventually shifted his clientele there two and a half years ago.  Besides general curative services and an observation ward, his facility offers a pharmacy, a laboratory, and maternal and child health services.  Dr. O. attributes his success to hard work, perseverance and assistance from KMET’s previous two microfinance loans.  He has been able to expand his facility, increase the number of services he offers, and improve the quality of care he provides.  Dr. O. carries a very good reputation from the many years of good work he has been doing in Kisumu.  His practice continues to grow as he attracts more corporate clients as well as private patients.  As he plans to further expand his facility, he has applied for a loan of Kshs 84,000 (approximately US$1.200) to purchase more advanced laboratory equipment, primarily, a calorimeter, in order to accommodate a greater variety of patients and more difficult cases.

loans.name: Agasamad

texts.en:
Agasamad is an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 30 years old.

His store consists of a little booth, where he and his friend sell audio disks. This single man hopes that in the future he will be able to save or take out a larger loan to open up a store where he will be able to sell a wider range of products and offer more services.

Now he wants $600 to expand his business and to increase range of goods.

loans.use: To expand his business and to increase range of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equpment for the hair salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock and open a new branch

texts.en: Jacob is a self-employed young businessman who started his business in 2002 after dropping out of school due to lack of school fees. He is single and lives with his parents. He is an active member of a local youth group who have motivated each other’s entrepreneur skills. With the help of a Pemci loan he is wishes to increase his stock and use the profits to support his siblings. Through his business Jacob has been able to act as a role model to other youth to start up business ventures to support themselves. Their goal is the eradication of poverty and crime in the community.

Margaret is married with 3 children in primary school. She started her business with assistance from her husband in 2005. With the loan of $150 from PEMCI she plans to expand her business in order to improve her income base. Through her cereals trading business she is ensuring food security for the local community especially during those times when there is drought and soon after the planting season when food availability is low.

Rhoda is married with two children. Both have finished schooling. She has undertaken training in Hotel Management but now she is a retired hotel manager. She is a caretaker of Chamasiri orphanage center and a member of the local women's church group where they deal with women empowerment. Rhoda started her business in 2002 to support her family. With the help of a loan of $150 from PEMCI, she hopes to expand her business. Through her business she will be able to support her family, the orphanage and the activities of the church.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a very active member of the PEMCI family. She is married with 3 school age children. This is her third loan with us.

Regina's first loan was repaid earlier than programmed. She used the second loan of $429 to boost her second-hand clothing business during the festive seasons in December 2006.

Although Regina is still repaying the earlier loan, she has approached us with a proposal to venture into New Clothes and Ladies Shoes, which we have agreed to fund in the amount of US$500. We believe that the combined income from the previous loan and this additional one will uplift her standards and business to a higher level.

loans.use: Diversify business into new clothes as well as second-hand clothing

texts.en: Rose is married	with three children who are all in primary school. She has not undergone any training. She started her business in 2002 and through her business she provides for her family. Her business involves buying cereals from the local farmers and selling them at the nearest market. With a loan from PEMCI, she intends to increase her stock to be able to meet the demands of her customers which she has been unable to due to lack of enough capital. Through her business she has inspired many community women to enroll together and start up small scale businesses that enable them to raise their social status and provide basic necessities.

loans.name: Kenia

texts.en:
Kenia has a small hardware store in her house. Kenia started the business with the help of a friend who made it possible for her to get merchandise to sell. In the the beginning she sold only electrical supplies. Now she continues to offer electrical products and also offers plumbing supplies.

She would invest the loan in faucets and painting supplies. She has complete confidence that her business will grow and she'll be able to continue making investments in it.

Kenia is the mother of three children. She is 30 years old. She has hope that this loan will give her financial security and allow her to save for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Kenia tiene una pequeña Ferretería en su vivienda. Kenia empezó el negocio con la ayuda de un amigo que le facilito la mercadería. Al principio solo vendía materiales eléctricos. Ahora ella continúa ofreciendo estos productos junto con todo lo relacionado a tuberías.

Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en accesorios de grifería y pinturas. Ella tiene toda la seguridad que su negocio crecerá y podrá seguir haciendo inversiones.

Kenia es madre de tres hijos, tiene 30 años. Ella tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y puede permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy hardware and electronic items to sell

texts.en:
Luis sells cleaning products for the home. He started his business selling these products door to door. He launched his business selling polish, sponges and clothespins. He continues to sell those products along with cleaning clothes and aluminum cleaner.

Luis would use the loan to buy products wholesale in order to earn more profit. He aspires to one day be a distributor so he could help and give work to other people. He has faith that with additional merchandise in stock his business will grow. Luis is the father of 2 children. He is 37 years old and married. Luis has hope that with this loan he'll improve his family's quality of life and bring stability and growth to his business.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Luis vende productos de limpieza para el hogar. Luis empezó su negocio vendiendo estos productos puerta a puerta. Se inicio vendiendo lustre, esponja, pinza. Ahora el continua vendiendo este mismo producto junto con toallas de limpieza y aluminio blanqueador. Luis usara el préstamo para invertir comprando estos productos al por mayor y así obtener mejores ingresos. El tiene la aspiración de llegar a tener una distribuidora, de esta manera poder ayudar y dar empleo a otras personas. El tiene la fe que teniendo mas mercadería en stock su negocio crecerá. Luis es Padre de dos hijos, esta casado, tiene 37 años. Luis tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le dará estabilidad y crecimiento al negocio.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin has a small bakery where he sells bread and sweets. Darwin learned the bakery business with the help of his brother and started the business selling bread from a tricycle. He continues to offer bread along with sweets and milk products.

Darwin would use the loan to buy an oven and a blender, in order to produce more bread to distribute to stores. He has confidence that with these new tools his business will grow.

Darwin has been with his wife for 3 years; she is currently pregnant. He is 25 years old. He is convinced that this loan will improve the economic status of his family and that his business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Darwin tiene una pequeña panadería donde vende panes y dulces. Darwin aprendiendo de este negocio con la ayuda de su hermano y empezó vendiendo pan en triciclo. Ahora el continúa ofreciendo este producto junto con dulces y lácteos.

Darwin usara el préstamo para ampliar su negocio comprando un horno y una batidora para así poder distribuir mayor cantidad de panes en tiendas. El tiene la plena seguridad que con esta nueva herramienta de trabajo va ha tener crecimiento.

Darwin esta unido con su esposa hace tres años quien se encuentra embarazada. El tiene 25 años. Darwin esta convencido que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico familiar y su negocio crecerá.

loans.use: Buy an oven and a blender

texts.en:
Marlene is a door to door cosmetics saleswoman. She started her business with the help of a friend, who provided the inventory with which she started the business. In the beginning she only sold perfumes, but now she also offers perfumes along with fashion accessories and make-up.

Marlene aspires to sell all types of cosmetics and accessories. She also hopes to start doing facials in the near future. She would invest the loan by purchasing her merchandise in cash instead of financing from the distributors. She has confidence that her business will grow with these new products.

Marlene is the mother of three children. She is 28 years old and married. Marlene has hope that this loan will give her financial security and allow her to both save for her children's education and continue construction on her home.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Marlene es comerciante de cosméticos puerta a puerta. Marlene empezó su negocio con la ayuda de una amiga quien le dio mercadería para que empezara su negocio. Al principio ella solo vendía perfumes. Ahora ella continúa ofreciendo perfumes junto con bisutería y maquillajes.

Marlene aspira vender todo tipo de cosméticos y bisutería además realiza limpieza de cutis. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir comprando mercadería a realización para así poder obtener mejores ganancias. Ella tiene la seguridad de que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá.

Marlene es madre de tres hijos. Ella tiene 28 años esta casada. Marlene tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y pueda permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y poder seguir construyendo su casa.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has a stand in his house where he sells fish. He started his business with 50 dollars of capital. In the beginning he only sold fish. He continues to sell fish along with other seafood, such as scallops, shrimp`and tilapia.

Francisco aspires to establish a freestanding store so that he can better serve his customers. He would use the loan to buy his products wholesale, which would allow him to sell at competitive prices and eventually set up a store. He has faith that with these new products his business will continue to grow.

Francisco is in a committed relationship and has 2 children. His business supports his family, since it is the sole means of paying the household expenses. Francisco has hope that this loan will allow him to enjoy economic stability and to save for his children's education.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco tiene un puesto en la esquina de su casa donde vende pescados. Francisco empezó su negocio con un capital de 50 dólares. Al principio el solo vendía pescados. Ahora continúa ofreciendo este producto junto con otros mariscos como concha, camarón y tilapia.

Francisco aspira establecer un local para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes. El usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar su producto a precios de mayorista y así vender a precios competitivos y eventualmente instalar un local. El tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio seguirá creciendo.

Francisco esta unido, padre de dos hijos. El tiene 34 años. El por medio de su negocio apoya a su familia ya que es su única entrada para solventar los gastos familiares. Francisco tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le permitirá tener estabilidad económica y ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy products wholesale and later set up a location for his business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos sells bread in his own store. He began his business after learning about baking at his former job. At first, he only sold bread. Now, he sells bread along with candies and other sweets, and he has two assistants who help distribute bread to local stores. Carlos hopes to sell other products like sugar and oil. He will use the loan to buy these new products. He hopes that the introduction of these new products will help him increase and reinvest in his business.

Carlos is 48 years old, married, and has two sons. He is from Manabí and he moved to Guayaquil to earn a better living. This loan will improve the quality of life for his family and help him grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos se dedica a la venta de pan en su propio local. Carlos empezó su negocio aprendiendo de su anterior trabajo. Al principio el solo vendía pan. Ahora el continua vendiendo este producto junto con dulces y tiene dos personas que reparten pan en tiendas. Carlos aspira vender otros productos como harina azúcar y aceite. El usara el préstamo para la compra de estos nuevos productos. El tiene fe que con la introducción de estos productos nuevos su negocio se incrementara y seguirá haciendo inversiones. Carlos es padre de dos hijos, unido tiene 48 años. Es oriundo de Manabí y se mudo a Guayaquil para tener mejores ingresos. El tiene la seguridad que el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y su negocio crecerá.

loans.use: Invest in flour and other baking products to sell.

loans.name: Geovanis

texts.en:
Geovanis sells sandals. She began her business by learning how to make sandals from her father, who is an artisan. At first, she only sold to family members. Now, she offers her product in neighboring provinces and to friends in the area. She will use the loan to invest in a variety of shoes and sandals for men and women. By buying in bulk, she will get a better price, and therefore earn a better profit. Geovanis believes her business will grow by offering a larger selection of styles to her clients.

Geovanis is 46 years old, married and has one daughter. She hopes that this loan will help her save to build a house and give her daughter a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Geovanis tiene ventas de sandalias. Geavanis empezó su negocio aprendiendo a elaborar las sandalias con las enseñanzas de su padre que es artesano. Al principio solo ofrecía su producto a familiares. Ahora ofrece su producto a provincias y amistades del sector. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar variedad de modelos de zapatos y sandalias tanto para damas como para caballeros a precio de mayorista y así que sus ingresos sean mayores. Geovanis tiene fe que su negocio crecerá con la variedad de modelos que ofrecerá a su clientela. Geovanis tiene 46 años es unida, tiene una hija. Ella tiene la esperanza de que este préstamo le ayudara ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darle una mejor educación a su hija.

loans.use: Invest in men and women's shoe apparel

texts.en:
Marcia sells baby clothes, strollers, and toys. She began her business with $100 dollars from a friend. At first, she only sold strollers and toys for babies. Now she sells baby walkers, diaper bags, and a range of baby products. Marcia will use this loan to buy new merchandise in bulk, such as lotions, shampoo and soaps. This way, she will earn a better profit. She believes that these new products will benefit her business and help it grow.

Marcia is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. She believes that this loan will give her family economic security and help her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcia vende ropa para bebes, coches y juguetes. Marcia empezó su negocio con la cantidad de $ 100 dólares que le facilito un familiar. Al principio solo vendía coches y juguetes para bebes. Ahora vende andadores, bolsos maternos y una gama de articulos para bebes. Marcia usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería al por mayor y en lociones, Shampoo, jabones. Así podrá obtener mejores ingresos para que su negocio crezca y poder tener un mejor ingreso. Ella tiene la seguridad que con estos nuevos productos su negocio se incrementara y tendrá mayores beneficios. Marcia tiene 38 años, esta unida, es madre de tres hijos. Ella tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y permitirle que su negocio crezca.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar is applying for his second loan with Kiva. He would like to thank the Kiva community for helping him with the first loan. He has a stand where he sells common Ecuadorian foods to the public. With the capital from his loan, he was able to invest in his business and generate enough profit to set up a similar stand for his wife. They both have been working hard to make their business a success during these last eight months. Now, Cesar not only sells encebollado, he also makes a variety of other typical Ecuadorian foods. With his next loan he hopes he can take the next step for his business and rent a place where he can set up a restaurant. He is very grateful for the support and hopes he can continue to be part of the Mifex and Kiva program.

loans.use: Rent a new location for his restaurant business

texts.en:
R. is 32 years old, and is married with two children, both girls aged 15 and 10. The eldest is attending senior high school, while the younger one is in elementary school. Her husband, Salim, does not have a fixed job, so he does odd jobs, carrying goods and off-loading trucks when he can.

R. buys waste material like plastic cups, plastic bottles, cardboard and paper from her neighbors and other houses in the village. Her husband uses a cart to collect scrap metal and other waste material. Households do not just give away waste material, because there is demand and therefore economic value in recycling. So the more working capital they have, the more scrap they can collect and recycle. Their own working capital is limited, at around $250. Having heard from her friends about MBK, R. has now applied to MBK to add to her working capital. Since this is the first time, R. can only borrow a maximum of $75 from MBK.

The recycling business consists of the following chain. R. and her husband are the first link in this chair, buying waste and scrap materials from households, sorting and cleaning them, before selling them to an intermediate dealer. This dealer comes around in a small truck, collects the sorted-out material and takes it to the warehouse dealer. There, the different materials are weighed in front of R.’s husband, who then gets paid by the intermediate dealer. The warehouse dealer in turn sends the waste material to various processing factories, which turn produce clean and reusable recycled paper, cardboard and plastic recycled raw materials. Waste recycling undertaken by R. and her husband thus helps clean the environment by reusing waste material which otherwise would go to the landfills.

loans.name: Abulfat

texts.en:
Abulfat is an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli, Khanlig village. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 52 and has 3 children. He is the only breadwinner in the family. He supports his family and has been engaged in this business for 6 years.

He has an ability to buy the best perfumery. He is very polite with all his clients. Abulfat decided to apply for a loan $300 in order to engage in retail trade. For the second time he borrowed $400 and varied the perfumery. The third time he borrowed the $600 in order to rent the perfume store. He applies for a loan of $1200 to open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods.

loans.use: To open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city.

He began his business 6 years ago, when he was 14 years old. In the beginning of his business he sold retail. Having borrowed the loan amount of $300 from Normicro he rented a grocery store. The second time he borrowed $400, he bought 90 pair of shoes and expanded his business. Parviz has rented a shoe store and he needs a loan of $800 to open his own shoe shop and to increase the range of shoes.

loans.use: To open his own shoe shop and to increase range of shoes

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
L. is 28 years old, and is married with three children aged 9, 4 and 1. The first two are boys while the last one is a girl. Her husband, Cecep. is an unskilled temporary worker in a small factory, earning $80 per month. L. and her family live in a very simple wooden house with an earthen floor.

To supplement her husband’s income, L. sells household goods like sugar, coffee, soap, washing powder, toothpaste and other toiletries by going around the village on foot and carrying two large plastic bags. Her present working capital is only $65 dollars, on which she earns only $20 a month. With the additional working capital from MBK of $55, she can buy more goods to sell around the houses, and thus more or less double her income. L. very much wants to earn more money for her children’s education, and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: Purchase household goods for resale around the village

texts.en: Margaret is a single mother of 4 young children. She lost her husband 2 years ago from HIV/Aids related complications. She trades in vegetables and fish products moving from one market center to another within her locality. With the profits from her small business she is able to support her children and also her elderly parents. Agnes’s case is typical of that faced by numerous women who have to fend for their young families in the absence of their husbands. With the loan of $150 she will be able to increase her stock and improve on her profitability. Hers is a worthwhile cause to support, as it will be impacting positively on a chain of dependents and the community at large.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is married with seven children. He started his livestock trading business 4 years ago in order to supplement his farming activities. He initially started by trading in chicken locally and gradually expanded his business to goats and has subsequently included cattle. He intends to use the US$400 loan from PEMCI to expand his livestock trade. He is very encouraged by the availability of such services and facilities and he is full of expectations for a bright future. The growth in his business has given him good standing in his community and many now seek his advice. He has become a very strong promoter of PEMCI’s services wherever he goes.

loans.use: To Improve and Increase Livestock Trading

texts.en: Catherine is married with 3 children. She started her shop in 2000 after selling some farm produce. Initially she ran a small eating-place but later opted for a shop. The shop supplements what she gets from her farm. Catherine is confident that with additional funds from PEMCI’s loan of US$ 150 she will be able to stock her shop and improve her profits. The shop serves the local community in her area. Community members don’t have to commute long distances to buy their basic requirements such as oil, sugar, salt etc...

Beatrice is married with 4 children in primary school. She started her cereal selling business in 1990 but it has remained small due to a lack of funding. She travels from one market to another buying and selling. She is able to support her family from the business. With the loan of US$150 from PEMCI she intends to increase her stock which will in turn improve her margins. She is also an active member of her local church community.

Sammy is a father of two and started his business in 2004. He initially traded in chicken and has gradually graduated to goats and cattle trade. He has been doing this business over the past 10 years. This is first time that an opportunity for a loan has availed itself to him. With the loan of US$150 from PEMCI, Sammy sees good prospects for his business. He will use the loan proceeds to grow his business and increase profits.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a single mother of 7 children. Her husband passed away leaving her 3 sons and 4 daughters. 2 daughters are married. The rest of the children are dependent on the little income that she generates. She operates a posho mill, which she runs in addition to selling maize and cassava for milling. With the loan of $150 she plans to purchase additional stock of maize and cassava for sale. Her business is doing quite well and the additional investment is expected to improve her income. With this additional income, her welfare and that of her children, will improve further raising the overall status of the local community.

loans.use: Purchase Cereals Stock for the Posho Mill

texts.en: Janerose is married with Eight children that are all in school. Her husband is a retired labour officer. She started her Business in 1999 and depends on it to support her family’s needs. With the help of her first loan of $90 from PEMFI, she was able to stock her business and support all her Children in Primary School. With the second loan of $150 from PEMCI, she will boost her stock in order to improve her income and service to her local community and also start an animal trading business.

Margaret is a widow and has five children, all boys. After her husband’s death, she had to think of how she could raise her children and that’s when she started the business. Through the money she got from selling her farm produce, she began buying cereals from markets nearby her and selling them to the people from her village. Through the business, she has been able to sustain her family for the last ten years. With a loan of US$150 from PEMCI, she intends to multiply her stock and reach out for people from other villages near her community.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with one son. After school he worked as an engineer. This experience helped him start his own business. Vladimir runs a small workshop manufacturing iron railings, grates, fences, etc. He has been in this business since 1996. Vladimir was one of the first entrepreneurs working in this sphere of business in the region. His turnover capital currently amounts to $4,000. Vladimir is very orderly, punctual and determined. He has a team of three employees working for him. Top rate manufactured products and flexibility in working with clients have ensured the success of Vladimir’s enterprise. Eight loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have also contributed to expansion of his business. Vladimir would like to get a loan of $1,000 to purchase metal roll used in manufacturing ornamental ironwork. The loan will help him increase his sales and gain additional profit. Vladimir is planning to invest generated funds in a second workshop manufacturing iron gates, railings, frames, fire grates and pokers. Age-old craft coupled with contemporary design will make this ironwork very unique and suitable to any customer’s taste, environment and budget requirements. It should also be mentioned that Vladimir has been a loyal donor to the Ukrainian Association for the Visually Handicapped for several years. Funds generated by the business will allow him to provide more financial assistance to partially sighted and blind people ensuring that impaired vision does not result in an impaired life.

Володимир – одружений, в нього є син. Після університету, він працював інженером. Отриманий досвід допоміг йому почати власну справу. Володимир – власник невеличкої майстерні, він займається виробництвом металевих огорож, поруччя, гратів тощо ще з 1996 року. Володимир почав працювати в цій сфері бізнесу одним з перших серед інших підприємців. Його робочий капітал складає 4000 доларів. Володимир – дуже зібраний, пунктуальний та наполегливий. Він працює разом з трьома іншими чоловіками. Високоякісні вироби та гнучкість в роботі з клієнтами забезпечують успіх в роботі. Вісім позик, які Володимир отримав від „Надії України”, також сприяли зростанню його бізнесу. Володимир хотів би отримати позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб купити металопрокат, який використовується для виготовлення декоративних металевих виробів. Позика допоможе йому збільшити обсяг продажів та заробити додатковий прибуток. Володимир планує вкласти зароблені кошти в роботу другої майстерні з вироблення металевих воріт, поруччя, рамок, камінних решіток тощо. Стародавні технології у поєднанні з сучасним дизайном підкреслять неповторність кожного деталі. Широкий вибір виробів на будь-який смак стане по кишені кожному та прикрасить будь-яку оселю. Варто також додати, що Володимир – постійний спонсор Товариства Сліпих України. Тому він планує передати частину коштів, які отримає від своєї діяльності, на допомогу людям, які частково або повністю втратили зір. Ця фінансова підтримка допоможе багатьом з ним відчути на собі, що послаблений зір – це не перешкода для повноцінного життя.

loans.use: To purchase metal roll to produce railings

texts.en:
Svitlana is a divorced mother with two daughters. Her husband left their family 13 years ago and she was forced to find ways to provide for herself and her daughters. She was familiar with the clothing retail business so she decided to borrow some money and start her own business selling clothes. Svitlana has been self-employed now for more than 5 years. She is very strong-willed and resolute. Her hard work, perseverance and ability to offer a wide assortment of clothing have helped her keep loyal clientele and expand her business. Presently, Svitlana has about $2,000 of working capital. Svitlana is requesting a loan of $800 to allow her to increase her inventory and to help open a new vending kiosk in another local market. She can purchase men and women’s clothing in bulk for good prices. If she is able to open a second sales kiosk, her sales activity will increase greatly and she will be able to meet the needs of more customers. This loan will give Svitlana a chance to expand her trade, increase profits, and invest in her business and her family’s future welfare.

Світлана – розлучена, в неї дві дочки. Її чоловік покинув родину ще 13 років тому. Отже, Світлана була змушена шукати можливостей забезпечувати себе та донечок. Вона зналася на одязі, тому вирішила позичити грошей та відкрити власну справу. Світлана працює сама на себе вже більше 5 років. Вона – дуже вольова та рішуча. Наполеглива праця та великий асортимент одягу допомогли їй зберегти вірних клієнтів та розширити власний бізнес. Зараз в Світлани – 2000 доларів в товарі. Світлана просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів та відкрити ще один кіоск на місцевому ринку. Вона планує оптом закупити чоловічий та жіночий одяг за помірними цінами. Коли вона відкриє другий кіоск, обсяг продаж значно виросте, а отже, вона зможе задовольнити попит багатьох покупців. Позика надасть Світлані можливість розширити торгівлю, збільшити прибутки, вкласти зароблені кошти в розвиток бізнесу та забезпечити потреби родини.

Ilya is married with a three-year old son. Creative thinking and designer’s talent motivated him to start his business manufacturing advertising billboards and signs. He has been in this business for 5 years. A systematic approach and the use of modern technologies have helped Ilya make his small business successful. Ilya is very determined and precise. He sets high goals and invests all his energy in realizing those goals. Ilya currently has three employees and rents a workshop which helps him run his business more efficiently. His working capital amounts to $1,600. Ilya has received and promptly repaid 23 loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Ilya is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase some new equipment, such as electric drills and fretsaws because the tools he’s been using are old and need frequent repairs. New equipment will give him more flexibility and improve the quality of the services his business provides. This will allow him to serve new customers and generate more profit. Ilya would like to use some of the added income to finish the remodeling of his apartment. Ilya believes his perseverance and hard work in combination with financial assistance will also help him fulfill his next goal - to open a second advertising business in a new city.

Ілля – одружений, в нього трьохрічний син. Креативне мислення та талант дизайнера дали йому змогу почати власний бізнес з виробництва рекламних щитів та вивісок. Він займається цим бізнесом вже 5 років. Систематичний підхід та використання сучасних технологій спряли успішному зростанню бізнесу Іллі. Ілля – дуже наполегливий та розсудливий. Він ставить важливі цілі та вкладає усю свою енергію в їхнє досягнення. Разом з Іллею працюють також три інших чоловіка, вони працюють в орендованій майстерні. В матеріали в нього зараз вкладено 1600 доларів. Ілля отримав та вчасно сплатив 23 позики від „Надії України”. Ілля просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб придбати необхідне нове обладнання, а саме: електричні дрилі та лобзики, тому ще інструменти, які він використовував, вже застарі та постійно ламаються. Нове обладнання зробить бізнес Іллі мобільним та значно покращить якість послуг, які він пропонує. Це допоможе йому обслуговувати більше клієнтів та отримувати додатковий прибуток. Ілля також планує частину зароблених коштів в облаштування власної квартири. Він переконаний, що наполеглива праця у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допоможуть йому досягти поставленої мети – відкрити ще одну рекламну агенцію на новому ринку.

loans.name: Vakil

texts.en:
58-year-old Vakil with his 2 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Fizuli region. Since 2001 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed first loans of amount $400 he significantly expanded his business, bought 2 calves. The loans were paid back timely.
Now Vakil applies for the loan $700 to buy 3 calves and to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves and to expand his business

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en: S. has a business where he sells chlorine and bleach. These products are very important to the people in his community due to the lack of infrastructure that breeds unsanitary conditions. They use these products to clean their clothes and homes. S. started off in this business with a loan provided by his sister. He used the loan to invest in the products and sell them to the end consumer, but now he has taken the next step and he is distributing to the small stores and markets in the area. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to invest in different types of cleaning products. He is 52 years old and is a widower. He has one son who is physically disabled. S. depends completely on his business to support his small family.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.en:
Javier M., married, father of 2 children, has a small farm located in the town of Carazo, 35 kilometers from Managua. The invested money will buy materials which will allow him to prepare his land for the planting of plantains. This field preparation will allow him to increase his production as well as increase his earnings and more importantly, give his children the opportunity to have a quality academic education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Javier M., casado, padre de 2 hijos, tiene una pequeña finca ubicada en la ciudad de Carazo a 35 kms de Managua, el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales que le permitan preparar el terreno para la siembra de Plátanos. Esta preparación le permitirá elevar su producción y por lo tanto elevar también sus niveles de ingresos y más importante aún le brindará a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una buena educación académica.

loans.use: The money obtained by PRISMA will buy insecticides to prepare the land for planting.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Sándor

texts.en:
Sandor A., married, father of one son, is the owner of a Cyber Cafe, which supports his family economically. He now has plans to expand his business and with the loan he recieves from PRISMA, he will buy 5 new computers and update the 5 computers he already owns. Futhermore, he plans on remodeling his cafe in order to install a small Bar, which he thinks will also help to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Sándor A., casado, padre de un hijo, es dueño de un Cyber café con el cual mantiene económicamente a su familia, actualmente tiene planes de agrandar su negocio, con el crédito que le otorgue PRISMA comprará 5 nuevas computadoras y actualizará las 5 computadoras que actualmente posee. Aademás acondicionará su local para instalar un pequeño Bar, con el cual piensa incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: The money obtained by PRISMA will buy more modern computers and to make improvements on the site.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos has 18 years of experience in his field. He worked alongside his father from the time he was young. He travels through neighborhoods buying used items house to house. He buys and fixes the items so that he can sell them at low prices in the poorer areas. He goes out in the streets looking for goods from 8 am to 2 pm. The business has allowed him to support his family and make some repairs to his home.

He needs the loan to buy used items in bulk, so that he can fix and sell them.

Carlos was born in Guayaquil He is 32 years old with 3 children, all still in school. His wife helps him around the house. At the moment they do not own their own home. They are a very humble and hardworking couple who persevere to get ahead. Their dream is that their children finish school and that their business grows, since it is the sole source of income for the family.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos tiene una experiencia de 18 años en esta actividad, desde joven se dedicó a trabajar junto a su padre. El negocio de él es recorrer las casas y comprar artefactos y artículos usados. Él compra y los arregla para poder venderlos a precios baratos para ciertas zonas pobres. Él sale a recorrer las calles de 8:00AM a 2:00PM. El negocio le ha permitido mantener a la familia y hacer ciertos arreglos en la casa.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar en lote sus artefactos y artículos para arreglarlos.

Carlos nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 32 años. Con 3 hijos todavía en la escuela. Su esposa le ayuda en su hogar. Actualmente todavía no tienen casa propia. Ellos son una pareja muy humilde y trabajadora que luchan por seguir adelante. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y que su negocio crezca porque es su única fuente de ingresos para el hogar.

loans.use: Buy used goods in bulk to repair and resell

texts.en:
Carlos has had his laundromat for 1 year. Since he was young, he has been a master builder. Because he never had continuous work in the construction field, he decided to start his laundry service. He rents washing machines in his neighborhood. With his own savings he was able to buy his washing machines, some in cash and some on credit. His wife and son help him fulfill his client orders. His business opens at 9 am. His previous work allowed him to finish his house with cement and launch his laundry business.

He needs the loan because he wants to buy 2 more washing machines to meet the demand for his services.

Carlos was born in Los Ríos. He is 45 years old with 4 children. His wife helps him around the house and tends to client orders. They are a couple that is always looking for a way to earn income both in the house and outside of it; they are enterprising and responsible. They have their own house and rent to 3 tenants, which brings in additional income. Their dream is to continue with the business and establish it well.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos tiene una lavandería desde hace 1 año. Su profesión desde joven es maestro constructor. En vista de que no tiene trabajo continuo se decidió poner su lavandería donde alquila lavadoras en su zona. Con sus propios ahorros de su trabajo él pudo comprar al contado y a crédito sus lavadoras. Su esposa y la hija le ayudan en los pedidos. Su horario de atención es de 9:00. Su anterior trabajo le ha permitido hacer su casa de cemento y emprender éste negocio.

Él necesita el préstamo porque desea comprar 2 lavadoras más, por su demanda que tiene.

Carlos nació en Los Ríos. Tiene 45 años. Con 4 hijos. Su esposa le ayuda en el hogar y en el negocio atendiendo los pedidos. Ellos son una pareja que siempre están buscando como generar ingresos en sus casas como fuera de ella, son personas emprendedoras y muy responsables. Tienen su casa propia y además 3 alquiles que son otros ingresos. Su ilusión es seguir en el negocio y establecerse bien.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo has 23 years of experience in his field. He learned the business when he was very young, while helping his father. His business is located on the street corner outside of his house. He sells fish, pork and beef. He tends to his business every day of the week in 2 shifts, morning and afternoon. Aside from his fish and meat business, Segundo also sell household items when business is slow. His work has allowed him to buy his house.

He needs the loan to buy a table on which to display his products and to buy a freezer.

Segundo was born in Los Ríos. He is 42 years old with 4 children, all of whom are still in school. His wife helps him in the business when he has to go out. She also has her own business selling chicken in a market. They have both been able to move their businesses ahead through their perseverance and sense of responsibility. With their earnings they bought a cement house. Their greatest satisfaction is that their children are in school and are taking advantage of the opportunity to study. Their aspiration is to strengthen their businesses since they are the only source of income for the family.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Segundo tiene una experiencia de 23 años en esta actividad. Aprendió con su padre desde joven cuando lo ayudaba. Él esta ubicado en la esquina de su casa y vende pescado, carne de res y cerdo. Todos los días de la semana atiende en 2 jornadas por la mañana y al atardecer. Segundo a parte de su negocio, él también se ha dedicado a vender artículos para el hogar cuando esta bajo su negocio. Su trabajo le ha permitido tener obtener su casa.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar una mesa y exhibir su producto, y abonar para un congelador.

Segundo nació en Los Ríos. Tiene 42 años. Con 4 hijos que están en la escuela y colegio. Su esposa le ayuda en el negocio cuando él tiene que salir. Ella también tiene su propio negocio de venta de pollo en un mercado. Ambos han podido salir adelante en sus negocios por su perseverancia y responsabilidad que le han puesto. Con los ingresos generados se compraron su casa de cemento y su satisfacción más grande es que sus hijos estudian y están aprovechando. Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio por que son sus únicas fuentes de ingresos.

loans.use: Make improvements to the stand where he sells his products and buy a freezer.

texts.en:
Amalia has 20 years of experience in her business. She used to sell clothing, but had to leave that business after her sister died. Amalia took on her sister's expenses, leaving herself without the capital she needed for her business. She has recently taken up selling clothing and cosmetics again, from 10 am till 5 pm every day.

Amalia wants to the loan so that she can invest it in working capital for her business, and increase her earnings.

Amalia is a single mother. She has 2 children, both working. They help her quite a bit with the needs of the household. She dreams of fixing up her home and she knows that she will succeed in doing so with the earnings her business generates little by little, and with the help of her children, who look after her.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Amalia tiene una experiencia de 20 años en el comercio. Ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, negocio que tuvo que dejar por un tiempo por que una hermana falleció y ella asumió los gastos lo que hizo que se quede sin capital. Nuevamente a retomado el negocio de venta de cosméticos y ropa, en horario de 10 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. todos los días de la semana.

Amalia desea el crédito para invertir en capital de trabajo para su negocio y poder ir mejorando sus ingresos.

Amalia es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya trabajan y le ayudan bastante en las necesidades del hogar, ella desea arreglar su casita, y sabe que lo lograra con las ganancias que poco a poco le generara el negocio y también con la ayuda de sus hijos que están pendientes de ella.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a store where she sells all types of food items. She has 3 years of experience. When she married her husband he motivated her to start a bazaar with some savings and loaned her $100. Later she started a food store because she was selling more food than other types of products. Her store is located in her mother's home; she is adapting an area of her own home, across the street, so that she'll be able to move the business there. She tends to the store every day of the week from 7 am to 9 pm. Her mother helps her take care of the business.

She needs the loan to food staples and buy milk products and meat. She has turned around the capital she initially invested in the business, which has allowed her to grow.

Esther was born on Guayaquil. She is 21 years old. She does not have any children. Her husband works as a door to door salesman selling eyeglasses and cases for cell phones. They are a young couple who fight to get ahead. Thanks to her husband's savings they bought a plot of land where they plan to build their house out of cane. Their dream is that their businesses grow, since they are the couple's only source of income.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Esther tiene una tienda donde vende toda clase de víveres para la comida. Su experiencia es de 3 años. Cuando se caso su esposo la motivo a poner un bazar con unos ahorros y presto $ 100, pero luego puso una tienda porque se vendía más estos productos. Su tienda esta ubicada en la casa de su madre, esta adecuando un espacio en su casa para trasladarse que es al frente. Ella atiende el negocio todos los días de la semana de 7:00 AM a 9:00PM, su madre también le ayuda atender.

Ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar sus víveres y comprar lácteos y carnes. Con su capital que ella invirtió le ha dado la vuelta lo que le ha permitido crecer.

Esther nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 21 años. No tiene hijos. Su esposo trabaja como vendedor ambulante vendiendo gafas, estuches para teléfonos. Ellos son una pareja joven que luchan por salir adelante. Gracias a los ahorros de su esposo ellos ya se compraron un terrero donde piensan construir su casa de caña. Su ilusión es que sus negocios crezcan ya que son sus únicos ingresos para su hogar.

loans.use: Buy food staples, milk products and meats

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva has a freezer from which she sells juices, soft drinks and beer. She started her business two years ago. Her husband motivated her and loaned her the capital to start selling beverages. Since the business is right in her house, she tends to it from 8 am until 11 pm every day.

She needs the loan in order to buy soft drinks and juices; she would like to expand her inventory to include sweets for children.

Eva was born in Guayaquil. She is 37 years old with 2 children. Her husband works as a soldier. He encouraged her to work. She has had to work since she was a little girl and she has not stopped up till today. They are humble and hardworking people with dreams of getting ahead. With their savings and a lot of effort they have succeeded in owning their own home, a cane house that they are remodeling with cement, little by little. Their dream is to strengthen Eva's business because it is something secure for them.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eva tiene un congelador donde vende: jugos, colas y cervezas. Comenzó desde hace 2 años. Su esposo la motivo y le prestó algo de capital para que se ponga a vender. Como el negocio esta en su casa lo atiende todos los días de 8:00AM a 11:00PM.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar: colas, jugos y desea incorporar golosinas para niños.

Eva nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 37 años. Con 2 hijos. Su esposo trabaja como soldador. Él la motivo a su esposa para que trabaje. Eva tuvo que trabajar desde niña y no dejado de hacerlo hasta ahora. Ellos son personas humildes y trabajadoras deseosas de salir adelante. Con sus ahorros y mucho esfuerzo han logrado tener su casa que es de caña y poco a poco la están remodelando a cemento. Su ilusión es fortalecer el negocio de Eva porque es algo seguro.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, juices, and sweets for children

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has 8 years of experience selling soft drinks at $.10 each. She goes out every day of the week at 6:00 AM to sell along the streets with the most traffic, and she comes home at 10:00 PM. Things have gone well for her in this business because she has been able to buy her own land and a wooden house. Her oldest son works with her, and he has been a great support.

She needs this loan in order to buy more soft drinks and a tricycle. With the income generated she will be able to reinvest in the business.

Carmen was born in Bolívar. She is 36 years old, with 2 children. She is a single mother. Ever since she was small, she has worked, starting in the country planting seeds. She also worked selling wood for the city. Because of her children's studies, she had to abandon her native home and to go live in the Isla Trinitaria neighborhood of Guayaquil. From there, she started her current business. Her desire is to strengthen this business. Since it has already permitted her to meet her basic needs, she has great hope that it will prosper.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Carmen tiene 8años de experiencia vendiendo vasos de gaseosas a $ 0.10. Ella sale todos los días de la semana a las 6:00AM a recorrer las calles que son de mayor circulación y regresa a las 10:00PM. En el negocio le va bien porque ha podido comprar su terreno y tiene su casa de madera. Su hijo mayor trabaja con ella y es de gran apoyo. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más gaseosas y un triciclo. Con los ingresos generados podrá reinvertir en el negocio. Carmen nació en Bolívar. Tiene 36 años. Con 2 hijos. Es madre soltera Ella desde pequeña comenzó ha trabajar en el campo sembrando, también se dedico a vender madera para la ciudad. Por los estudios de sus hijos tuvo que abandonar su casa natal para ir a vivir en la Isla Trinitaria- Guayaquil. Desde allí se dedico a su negocio que todavía lo realiza. Su deseo es fortalecer el negocio ya que le ha permitido satisfacer sus necesidades primarias y tiene mucha esperanza de que va a prosperar.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and a tricycle.

texts.en:
Jenny has been working in this business for two years. She learned this traD. from her current husband (she is divorced from her first husband). She works every day of the week from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM, purchasing used cans which they clean out and re-sell to hardware stores, which fill them with paint and sell them again.

Jenny wants this loan in order to have capital so that they can buy the cans in bulk, at a lower price, so they can make a greater profit.

Jenny is 52 years old, she is married with 9 children, only one of whom still lives with her, as the rest are all married. She hopes little by little to remodel her home, which is of mixed construction, so that in winter there is a problem with things getting wet and damaged.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Jenny lleva ya trabajando en el negocio dos años. Aprendio L. actividad del comercio D. su esposo actual ya que elL. es separada D. su primer compromiso. El negocio actual lo realiza todos los días D. L. semana en horario D. 6 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. en L. que regresan a casa y comienzan a limpiar los tarros que han comprado para luego venderlos a las ferreterías para que los llenen D. pintura y vendan. Jenny desea el crédito para poder tener capital para L. compra D. mas tarros los cuales les saldrían mas barato al comprar al por mayor y con ello obtendría mas ganancia. Jenny tiene 52 años, tiene compromiso y 9 hijos D. los cuales solo una vive con elL. los demás ya tienen su compromiso. ElL. poco a poco desea ir arreglando su casita ya que es D. construcción mixta y en época D. invierno sufre por que sus cosas se pueden dañar al mojarse.

Jennifer has ten years of experience in the business of selling clothes, a trade she learned through working with her mother. When her mother went to another country, she took over the business, since she already knew the suppliers. That's how she has keep the business going until today. She works every day of the week, from 10:00 AM until 6:00 PM.

Jennifer wants this loan in order to be able to buy seasonal articles, as she already has a lot of orders, and in that way to supply her business.

Jennifer is a single mother, she has 2 children who are in school. Currently she is living in her mother's house, because her mother is living in Italy and Jennifer is taking care of the house, hoping one day to be able to have her own little house and to give a better life to her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Jennifer lleva ya 10 años en el negocio de la venta de ropa, actividad que la aprendió de su señora la madre a la cual le ayudaba. Su mama tuvo que viajar y ella tomo el negocio ya que conocía las personas a las que les dejaba mercadería y así fue como hasta el día de hoy ella mantiene el negocio. Lo trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 10 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Jennifer desea el crédito para poder comprar prendas para la temporada ya que tiene bastante pedido, y así también poder surtir su negocio. Jennifer es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian. Actualmente vive en la casa de la mama, ya que la señora esta residiendo en Italia y Jennifer a quedado al cuidado de la casa, esperando algún día poder tener su propia casita y darle una mejor vida a su familia.

Zoila has three years of experience in the business of renting washing machines, which she started with the help of her husband who bought her the first two machines. With these she started at first doing laundry at home, until the business developed and now she has reached the level of owning 7 washing machines, thanks to the effort of the entire family. She works every day of the week from 6:30 AM to 7:00 PM, with the help of her son, who is the one who delivers the washing machines to customers.

Zoila wants this loan in order to buy two more washing machines to increase her business.

Zoila is 44 years old, she is married, with 4 children, 2 of whom are still in school. Her husband has a cart which he uses to transport freight and in that way help the household.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Zoila lleva ya tres años con el negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, el cual lo inicio por ayuda de su esposo que le compro dos lavadoras. Con esas empezó primero lavando en casa, hasta que el negocio le fue bien y ha logrado comprar 7 lavadoras a base del negocio y esfuerzo de toda la familia. El negocio lo atiende todos los días de la semana en horario de 6:30 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. con la ayuda de su hijo que es el que traslada las lavadoras a domicilio. Zoila desea el crédito para poder comprarse unas dos lavadoras más ya que al momento ella tiene buena acogida con su negocio. Zoila tiene 44 años, esta casada con 4 hijos de los que 2 todavía estudian. Su esposo tiene un carrito de segunda en el cual el trabaja haciendo fletes y esta manera ayuda al hogar.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto has been a fisherman for over 26 years. He learned the trade from his father, who he worked with for several years before starting his own operation. He not only fishes his own products, he also travels to the markets to sell them himself, along with his wife.

Unfortunately Roberto learned about the Mifex program due to a tragic event. Three weeks ago his home burned down in a fire that also took three other households. One of the other homes belonged to the daughter of, Pedro Ramirez , a Mifex and Kiva borrower. Pedro advised Roberto to seek a loan from Mifex in order to restart his life. Roberto will use the loan to replace the fishing rod and canoe that were lost in the fire. Although they are very upset about the loss of their personal belongings and home, they are determined to rebuild their lives. They have two children that also lost all of their clothing and toys in the fire.

Roberto is pictured here in the blue hat, along with the other victims from the fire.

loans.use: To buy a new canoe and fishing rod.

texts.en:
Irina is married with one son. She runs a small business in Kherson, Ukraine selling clothing for men and women. Her kiosk is located in one of the busiest city markets where multiple vendors offer almost every imaginable product to passing customers. A beautiful array of assorted clothes attracts many clients to Irina’s kiosk. Irina is a hard-worker and a talented business manager. She has maintained an excellent credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine” without any defaults. Irina is very devoted to the success of her business and we believe she will have no problem keeping a perfect credit record. Irina is requesting the above amount to improve her business by stocking more clothing items which will allow her to expand her business and clientele. This financial contribution will not only have a positive impact on the business profitability, but it will go further amd improve the social and economic status of Irina, her employees and their families.

Ірина – одружена, в неї є син. Вона – власниця кіоску в Херсоні, займається продажем чоловічого та жіночого одягу. Її торгове місце знаходиться на одному з найбільших ринків, де покупцям можуть запропонувати найрізноманітніші продукти та товари. Широкий вибір різноманітного одягу приваблює багатьох потенційних покупців до кіоску Ірини. Ірина – дуже працьовита, вона талановитий бізнес менеджер. Під час роботи з „Надією України” вона встигла зарекомендувати себе як дуже відповідальна людина, яка завжди сплачує позики вчасно. Ірина віддана успіху своєї справи, в неї не буде жодних проблем зі сплатою отриманої позики. Ірина хотіла б отримати поизику для того, щоб закупити більше одягу, що допоможе їй розширити клієнтську базу та покращити свій бізнес. Цей фінансовий внесок не тільки позитивно вплине на прибутковість бізнесу Ірини, але й в подальшому сприятиме покращенню економічного та соціального статусу її підлеглих та рідних.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with one daughter. After school she was unable to find a good paying job in her field of training so she decided to start her own business selling jean clothing. She has been in business now for 4 years. Trendy clothes and her natural friendliness have helped her business be successful. Irina is very cheerful and resolute. Her main goal is to provide a level of customer friendly service that exceeds her clients’ expectations, creates repeat customers, and attracts new customers to her kiosk. Her entrepreneurial talent and hard work in combination with 10 loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped promote the dynamic growth of her business. Irina would like to purchase a new vending kiosk. This loan for $1,000 will allow her to purchase a kiosk and will increase her working capital so that she can expand her inventory of quality, durable jean shorts, jackets, jean sets etc. and better meet the growing demands of her clients. Successful, stable growth in Irina’s business will help provide a more secure future for her employees and family.

Ірина – одружена, в неї одна дочка. Вона певний час не могла знайти гарно оплачувану роботу за своєю спеціальністю, отже, вирішила відкрити власну справу й продавати джинсовий одяг. Ірина займається цим бізнесом вже 4 роки. Модний одяг та природна відкритість Ірини допомогли їй досягти успіху в бізнесі. Ірина – дуже жвава та рішуча. Вона завжди намагається запропонувати своїм покупцям високий рівень обслуговування, що допомагає їй зберегти постійних клієнтів та привабити нових. Заповзятливість та наполеглива праця у поєднанні з 10 позиками від „Надії України” сприяли динамічному зростанню бізнесу Ірини. Ірина хотіла б придбати новий кіоск. Саме тому вона просить про позику в 1000 доларів, яка допоможе їй збільшити свій робочий капітал, закупити якісний товар, а саме, джинсові шорти, куртки, костюми тощо, а також краще задовольнити потреби своїх покупців. Успішне, стабільне зростання бізнесу Ірини забезпечить спокійне майбутнє для її підлеглих та рідних.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending kiosk

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with one son. She is a Technical school graduate and worked for a while as a design engineer, but was unable to earn a stable salary. Seeking another source of income, Ludmila decided to start her own small business. She rented a kiosk and began selling household chemicals. Recently, however, Ludmila decided to make a change in the type of products she offers and start selling knitted wear and caps. She believes this new area of trade will help her generate additional profit. Ludmila is very responsible and determined. She’s been in business for 11 years and can easily guess the preferences of her clients which helps build customer loyalty. Her integrity and perseverance have helped Ludmila keep her business stable allowing her to pay back 11 loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Presently, Ludmila has around $1,000 of working capital. Ludmila would like to get a loan for $800 to buy more clothing products. She is planning to purchase knitted wear and warm caps that always sell well in Ukraine in the winter and spring. Her first month of sales with the new products was very successful which has encouraged Ludmila to proceed with this trade and expand her clothing sales business. This loan will help Ludmila’s business continue to grow ensuring the well-being of her family and helping to provide an education for her son at a good college.

Людмила – одружена, в неї один син. Вона закінчила технікум та певний час працювала інженером-проектувальником. Однак, зарплатню вона отримувала дуже нестабільно. В пошуках інших джерел заробітку Людмила вирішила почати власну справу. Вона орендувала кіоск та почала торгівлю побутовою хімією. Нещодавно Людмила вирішила змінити тип товарів та продавати трикотажні вироби. Вона вважає, що ця нова сфера торгівлі допоможе їй отримати додатковий прибуток. Людмила – дуже відповідальна та наполеглива. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 11 років, може легко передбачити побажання клієнтів, що допомагає їй зберегти постійних покупців. Чесність та відданість своїй справі забезпечили стабільність бізнесу Людмили та допомогли їй вчасно сплатити 11 позик, які вона отримала від „Надії України”. В товар в неї вкладено 1000 доларів. Людмила просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб купити більше одягу. Вона планує закупити трикотажні вироби та теплі шапки, які завжди користуються попитом в Україні під час зимового та весняного періодів. Перший місяць продажу виявився дуже успішним. Отже, Людмила вирішила продовжувати торгівлю та розширити бізнес з продажу одягу. Ця позика сприятиме подальшому зростанню бізнесу Людмили, а також забезпечить добробут її родини та навчання сина в гарному навчальному закладі.

Mariya is married and tragically has just lost her only son. She tries to do everything she can to support her daughter-in-law in the loss they have both experienced. Mariya is retired from her career work, but her retirement income was not sufficient to meet the needs of her family. To supplement her pension she decided to take a risk and start her own business selling winter clothing. She rented a kiosk in one of the busiest city markets, purchased some merchandise to sell and started back to work. Mariya is persistent and hard-working. She has received and promptly repaid all loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has now been in business for 10 years and currently has around $1,500 of working capital for her business. Mariya is requesting a loan of $700 to increase her clothing stock in preparation for the spring season. She is planning to buy quality jackets, coats and sweaters that are both durable and trendy. A wider assortment of merchandise will boost sales and expand Mariya’s business. The loan will not only improve the quality of her selection and attract more customers, but will go further to help Mariya meet the needs of her family and provide a better livelihood for them.

Марія – одружена. Вона нещодавно втратила свого єдиного сина. Зараз вона намагається всіма силами підтримати свою невістку. Марія вже на пенсії, але грошей, які вона отримує їй не вистачає для того, щоб забезпечити потреби родини. Отже, вона вирішила ризикнути та почати власний бізнес з продажу зимового одягу. Марія орендувала кіоск на одному з найбільших ринків міста, закупила товар та почала працювати. Марія – дуже наполеглива та працьовита. Вона отримала та вчасно сплатила всі позики від „Надії України”. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. В товар у неї вкладено 1500 доларів. Марія просить про позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент одягу напередодні весни. Вона планує закупити якісні куртки, пальта та светри, які будуть довговічними й модними. Розширення асортименту товарів обов’язково сприятиме збільшенню обсягів продажу та розширенню бізнесу Марії. Позика допоможе не тільки обновити товар та привабити більше покупців, але й допоможе Марії забезпечити потреби родини та якісно покращити рівень їхнього життя.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two children. She runs a small business selling clothing and accessories at a local market. Tatyana has been in this business for 10 years. She is a very industrious and hard-worker. Her integrity, determination and perseverance have ensured the sustainability and growth of her business. Tatyana has gradually been able to save some money and reinvest it in her business. Together with loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”, she has been able to increase her inventory and sales volume. Presently, she has about $1,500 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to around $200. Tatyana is requesting a loan for $500 that will allow her to increase her assortment of inventory for the spring season. She is planning to buy sweaters, caps and purses in bulk for further retail sales. She would also like to purchase small items such as electric light bulbs, matches, plastic bags and a variety of other little necessities that always sell so well and will supplement her clothing sales. This loan will help Tatyana increase her inventory and cater to an ever increasing number of customers further promoting stable expansion for her business.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона – власниця бізнесу з продажу одягу та аксесуарів на місцевому ринку. Тетяна займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Вона дуже заповзята та працьовита. Її чесність, наполегливість та цілеспрямованість забезпечили стабільність та зростання її бізнесу. Тетяна змогла заощадити гроші та вкласти їх у власну справу. Завдяки позикам від „Надії України” вона змогла збільшити асортимент товарів та обсяги продажів. Зараз в товар в Тетяни вкладено 1500 доларів. Її чистий прибуток складає 200 доларів. Тетяна просить про позику в 500 доларів тому, що ці гроші допоможуть їй збільшити асортимент товарів напередодні весни. Вона планує оптом закупити светри, шапки та сумочки для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Тетяна також хотіла б придбати різні дрібні товари, наприклад, електричні лампочки, запальнички, сірники, пакети та різноманітні товари, які знадобляться в побуті. До того ж вона планує урізноманітнити асортимент одиниць одягу. Позика допоможе Тетяні збільшити обсяги товару, задовольнити зростаючий попит з боку покупців, а також сприятиме стабільному розвитку її бізнесу.

loans.use: To purchase wider assortment of inventory

texts.en:
Yanina is married with one son. After completing schooling, both she and her husband were unable to find good paying jobs due to high unemployment rates in Ukraine. The family was forced to look for other sources of income to provide for their needs. Yanina’s husband went abroad in search of work. Yanina had always wanted to be self-employed so she decided to start her own business selling women’s lingerie. She has been in this business for about a year. Her polite manner and natural cheerfulness have helped Yanina generate clientele and operate her business successfully. Loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have been a big help as she’s established and begun to expand her business. To meet growing demand from her customers, Yanina is requesting a loan of $500 which will allow her to purchase more silk, cotton and linen underwear at wholesale prices. Her goal is to increase her turnover capital which will allow her to purchase additional merchandise at affordable prices. Good quality women’s lingerie at discounted prices will attract many potential customers and boost Yanina’s sales promoting the consistent growth of her business and providing stable income for her family.

Яніна – одружена, в неї один син. Після університету вона та її чоловік не могли знайти гарно оплачувану роботу через високий рівень безробіття в Україні. Отже, вони були змушені шукати інші джерела прибутку для того, щоб забезпечити потреби родини. Чоловік Яніни поїхав за кордон в пошуках заробітку. Яніна вирішила працювати на себе, почала власний бізнес з продажу білизни для жінок. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже десь рік. Її ввічливість та природна жвавість допомогли Яніні знайти свого покупця та досягти успіху в бізнесі. Позики від „Надії України” також сприяли поступовому розвитку та розширенню її бізнесу. Для того, щоб задовольнити зростаючий попит, Яніна просить про позику в 500 доларів. Ці кошти дадуть їй змогу придбати більше білизни з шовку, бавовни та льону за оптовими цінами. Яніна планує збільшити робочий капітал та придбати більше товару за помірним цінами. Якісна жіноча білизна за низькими цінами привабить багато нових потенційних покупців та сприятиме зростанню темпів продажу, що, в свою чергу, забезпечить стабільний ріст бізнесу Яніни та допоможе отримати додаткові прибутки.

Lizzy sells local maize meal known as kenkey to a large community of about 2,600 people. She is a leader of her community and very energetic. Lizzy has participated in the TEACH lending methodology of Kraban Support Foundation. She wants $750 from Kiva to support her operations.

Adjelenye trades in banku, a local product made from corn. Her business is a fast food venture. She prepares this cooked food made from corn and sells to the public in a local restaurant. She has participated in the TEACH lending skills program and graduated in Basic Business development programme. She needs a loan of $800 from Kiva.

Aggie is a dressmaker and wants a new sewing machine. She would like to recruit an apprentice to assist her in the sewing venture. She has been trained by the TEACH program staff of Kraban Support Foundation. She wants a loan of $1050 from Kiva. She has promised to repay on-time to enable her take a second loan.

Mary is an exciting woman who plies her trade with lots of humor and diligence. She is affable and very astute in her trading venture. Mary would like to increase her sales and therefore needs more capital to support her business. She needs a Kiva loan of $1200 to buy purchase more cooking utensils for sale.

Alice's business is cosmetic retailing. She has been a very good client of the Kraban Support Foundation. She has participated in all of our TEACH programs and has graduated from the Basics to the Advanced stages of the programs. She wants a loan amount of $800 from Kiva.

Josey wants to extend her operations to a neighboring community and needs more capital. She has a shop that operates day and night selling children's clothing. She would need a loan of $750 to improve her business.

loans.name: Nassor

texts.en:
Nassor is 33 years old and married with one son. He lives in Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. He owns a retail pharmacy selling medicines. His business is licenced with the local authorities.

His business often has to face running out of stock. The area where he lives is prone to malaria and waterborne diseases like cholera and amoebic dysentery, so drugs for these diseases have a high turnover in his pharmacy. Nassor has a plan to add a supply of medicines especially for malaria and waterborne diseases.

In the future, he plans to open another pharmacy. For now, he wants to expand the existing shop. This strategy will help him increase his family's income and take care of the school expenses for two children left by his late brother.

Nassor is in need of $750 to buy the stock he needs.

loans.use: To add to stocks of medicine.

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena lives in Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has five children. Two are in primary school, another two are in secondary school and the last one is in kindergarten.

Hellena owns a retail shop selling various consumable items, mainly food. She has operated her shop for more than six years now. The shop has been the main source of income for the family.

Her husband is a commuter bus driver - his income cannot meet the numerous family demands. She recently realized that her shop's profit margin has been decreasing because of an increased number of competitors.

In a plan to improve her profit margin, Hellena has decided to expand the shop by adding different categories of food items. She has noticed that her customers travel a long way to the market to look for food items which could easily be stocked in her shop.

Her new strategy needs additional capital. From her own savings, Hellena has managed to finance 20% of the business plan. She needs $550 to make up the difference.

She expects this strategy will enable her make more income so that she can meet her family requirements and pay school fees for her children. She has a dream of becoming a big wholeseller in her area.

loans.use: Add to stocks of food items

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa lives in Mbagala, Temeke District in Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child.

Sharifa runs a tailoring business from the verandah of her home. Business has not been good recently - she doesn't have enough sewing materials and she faces competition from her neighbours.

She wants to improve her business by having a better supply of sewing materials and renting business premises. The verandah of her house does not attract customers and does not provide her with enough space.

She also needs to buy two sewing machines and employ one assistant. Her strategy requires a capital boost of $550. Sharifa dreams of being a professional dressmaker in the near future.

loans.use: Adding to stocks of sewing and tailoring materials and buying two sewing machines.

loans.name: Phebe Lum

texts.en:
Phebe is a widow with seven children, determined to forge ahead despite constant painful memories of her husband’s death, the death of her son-in-law, and an incident when she couldn’t afford medication for her baby. Having received training in marketing techniques, pig farming, and credit management organized by GHAPE, since 2003 she has borrowed and repaid loans of $40, $150 and $190. She succeeded in producing manure for cultivation and meat for her community.

With a loan of $400, she plans to expand her pig farm by buying planks to construct 2 stalls in the fence and buy 2 piglets. She plans to cultivate vegetables using manure from her pig sty. She will also buy a tray, papers, and kola-nuts to start selling. She will again supply food and manure to neighbors and snacks (kola-nut) to old people, and will increase the supply of foodstuff and meat in the community.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Pigs and crop cultivation for human consumption

texts.en: Paulina is a trader in textiles. She has been trained by the Kraban Support Foundation in the TEACH lending methodology to enable her to keep records of her business. She now has a simple notebook in which she keeps her daily sales. She has indicated to the field officer that her profit margin has improved tremendously. She needs a loan facility of $850 from Kiva.

Margaret is one of two wives and mother of five children and six step-children. She has received training in “Achuboh” (cooking and retailing food by the roadside), marketing techniques and management skills. She successfully repaid her first two loans and provided lunch to the hungry.

With $600 she plans to increase her business by buying pots, plates, buckets, spoons, firewood, palm-oil, 4 bags of corn, a bag of beans and containers for preservation. She will provide breakfast and lunch to bachelors, day-students, hawkers, laborers and travelers.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.name: Anna Abanji

texts.en:
Anna is one of five wives and mother of five children. Her goal in life is to see her children graduate from college or vocational training and become independent. She has had training in business techniques, credit and management skills, and has experience-sharing sessions at Center meetings organized by GHAPE. She was given a loan of $40 in 2005 and $130 in 2006.
