payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en: Seyevush M. is 52 years old and is married with 3 children. Seyevush owns a car wash on the main road that passes by Aghsu. He started his business 2 years ago. He wants to improve his business and with the $500 loan purchase equipment to make his work more efficient.

loans.name: Taei Lio

texts.en: Taei is married and lives Siumu with her husband and 4 children. She has always enjoyed and been good at making Samoan oil (a therapeutic oil produced from coconut oil and essential oils of Samoan plants) that is mainly used by locals to massage and heal sick people. At first it wasn't easy because she needed more time to commit to making her local oil and she had little money. She wasn’t able to make her business a reality until she joined SPBD. Taei struggled to start her business but she didn't give up the battle and 2 years after beginning her business she continues the fight to increase it every day. She’s aiming to print her own labels to attach to the bottles so that people can easily order directly  straight from her. Her own recipe for making Samoan Oil will remain with her, and she hopes to pass it on to her children in the future.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for making Samoan oil – coconut oil, essential oils, and bottles

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Taufau

texts.en: Taufau is married with one son. She used to be a teacher but she taught for only 5 years then resigned because she wasn’t unable to earn a stable salary. Seeking another source of income, Taufau decided to start her own small business. She asked permission from her relatives for a piece of land she can use, and was granted a ½ acre plot to start her taro plantation. Taufau is a Christian lady who believes in the power of prayers. She began her business in 2004 and it is becoming really successful. She supplies taro to village people who make taro chips, and also supplies hotels nearby, and has found herself a market to export her Taro to our neighboring island that is under control by America. She believes her new market of trade will help her generate additional profit. Her main goal is for her business to grow, ensuring the wellbeing of her family and helping to provide an education for her son at a good college.

loans.use: Buy organic fertizers, pesticides, and knives

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali A. is a refugee from the region of Shusha. For the past 13 years he has lived in the village of Qaraqoyunlu in the Agsu region. Ali has raised cattle, sheep and goats for the past 10 years. He is married with two children. He is using the loan to purchase food and supplies for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy food for his animals

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is very energetic and is experienced in making brooms. She’s a single mother of three sons. Telesia lives in a small open Samoan house with her sons. All the three sons are attending district school, and they love their mother so dearly that they always rush home after school to help their mother put together brooms. On Saturdays, all her sons used to walk around the village to sell these brooms. Some days they wouldn’t be able to sell a single broom, so Telesia would send her eldest son to the market in the city of Apia to sell the brooms. One day Telesia was overwhelmed when she received a letter from a well-known business women in Samoa asking her to sign a 3-year supplier’s contract. Telesia is overjoyed that she has found herself a market, instead of her sons walking under the heat of the sun to sell her brooms.

loans.use: Buy a set of knifes and rubber for tying brooms

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en: Tamara O. has kept bees for honey production for the last 25 years. She lives in the Gegeli village in the Agsu region with her husband and six children. She hopes to purchase more equipment to expand her business.

Valeh Q. is an Internally-Displaced Person (IDP) from the region of Shusha in Azerbaijan. He fled with his wife and children 13 years ago to the region of Ahsu in the Qaragoyunlu village. He has raised sheep and cows for the past 25 years. With this loan he hopes to purchase more livestock and to improve his business.

loans.name: Soltan

texts.en: Soltan S. lives in the city of Agsu and owns a ironworks shop where, for the past 10 years,he has made gas and wood burning furnaces for homes and offices. He is 47 years old. Soltan is married and has two children. With this loan he hopes to purchase more materials and to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for his business

texts.en: Toaiva is a single 25 year old lady. She is from a family of six; her parents, 2 brothers and one sister. Toaiva is the youngest in the family and the only child staying with her parents. All of her brothers and sister have moved to stay with their wives and husbands. Toaiva has always helped out her father with his plantation, and so her father had faith in her and passed on his business to her. Toaiva now runs the farm with help from her boyfriend. She’s really enjoying running the business, aiming to keep the business growing to get good money to build a nice house for her parents, and maybe finance her dream wedding day.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

texts.en:
Naiba is a 24-year old dairy woman, single, living in Khaladj village in the Salyan region .
She has run her dairy business for 10 years. With this business she provides income and provides milk for her family.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is a young, talented woman and she’s from the village of Levi Saleimoa.  She’s forty one (41) years of age and married to a forty two (42) year old man from Tuanai.  They have six children, all raised at Levi Saleimoa.  Akenese’s family depends primarily on their fishing business that is jointly managed by both wife and husband. This additional loan will help improve their business by having more than one canoe with nets for running the business.

loans.use: Purchase additional fishing nets and a canoe with outrigger

texts.en: Aslan M. has kept bees for honey production for the past six years. He currently lives in Ulguc village in the Agsu region with his wife and three children. With this loan he wants to buy more bees for his honey production.

loans.name: Xalide

texts.en: Xalide C. (her employee is pictured) owns a market in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. She is one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of female entrepreneurs. Xalide wants to increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase inventory with more diversified products

texts.en: Eli I. (his employee is pictured) owns a computer/stationary store In the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Eli is looking for funding so that he can purchase new computers for his store.

30-year-old Aynura lives in Yenikand village,Salyan region. She is married and has a child.
She has run her business for 5 years.
Aynura would like to adopt new  farming technology to boost her agricultural yield.
She wants to be able to meet the financial responsibility and to maintain her family but she lacks the capital.
She requests a loan of $800 to buy fertilizer and seed.

Seyfulla Z. lives in the Ulguc village in the Agsu region of Azerbaijan. He raises cattle and sheep. He is 46 years old and is married with four children. He wants to purchase additional animals to expand his business.

loans.name: Anagiz

texts.en: Anagiz M. owns a beauty supply store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Anaqiz wants to increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory

loans.name: Pola

texts.en: Pola T. is a woman from the village of Levi Saleimoa, born and raised at Safotu Savaii.  She’s fifty-two (52) years of age married to a man from the village of Levi Saleimoa, where they are living with their four children.  Pola is gifted by God with the talent of sewing.  She’s doing a good job to help meet her family needs, especially her children’s fees in school.  She has more than twenty people coming to her for sewing materials, and she had done a great job satisfying her customers by giving them what they have asked for. With this loan she hopes to buy an additional sewing machine and more materials to meet the growing demand for her designs.

loans.use: Purchase one sewing machine, additional fabrics, threads, buttons and other sewing needs

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin K. lives and works in the Ulguc village in the region of Agsu. He is single and supports his mother and father. He opened up a small store one year ago and is hoping to expand his current store with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to build onto his current shop

loans.name: Sedaget

texts.en: Sedaget Z. (her mother is pictured) owns a furniture store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. She is one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of female entrepreneurs. She is looking for funding so that she can invest in a greater quantity and quality of furniture.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for her store

texts.en: Firangiz H. has sold clothing out of her home in Agsu city for the past ten years. She is a 59-year-old widow with two children. She hopes with this loan to purchase a place in the bazaar to sell clothing.

loans.name: Lima

texts.en: Lima is fine, talented woman. She’s from the village of Levi Saleimoa.  She’s sixty-two years of age and she runs a pancakes canteen for the village school.  Lima’s experience in making pancakes makes her the best seller within her area.  She’s doing fine with her business and earns money to meet both the business and the family needs.  One of her sisters is helping her run the business project. A loan will help her purchase a new stove and additional ingredients for her growing pancake business.

loans.use: Purchase a new stove, a sack of flour, sugar, flavourings, eggs, and other ingredients

loans.name: Talib

texts.en: Talib T. (his mother in pictured) owns a small market in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. He would like to increase the quantity and variety of his inventory so that he can attract more customers to his store.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and diversity of his inventory.

loans.name: Rahil

texts.en: Rahil M. owns a cell phone store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Rahil wants to invest in newer products for his store in order to attract more business.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory to attract more customers.

texts.en: Elnur H. is an Internally-Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He fled to Agsu 13 years ago. He is married with two children. For the past three years he has owned a small booth at the local bazaar where he sells men's and women's clothing. With this loan he wants to increase his current inventory and improve his business.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud M. owns an Auto Parts store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Mahmud is looking for funding so that he can increase the number of parts available allowing him to increase his customer base.

loans.use: To purchase Auto Parts that will allow him to service more types of vehicles

texts.en: Mahir S. lives in Agsu city and owns a small general store in the local bazaar. He opened up the store two years ago. He lost both his sister and brother during the conflict that left tens of thousands of people internally displaced.  Mahir currently supports not only his wife and two children, but also his parents as well as his brother's family. He hopes to use this loan to purchase more inventory and increase his business.

Perviz M. is 26 years old and single living in Agsu city. He started selling men's and women's clothing in the local bazaar two years ago. Perviz wants to increase his inventory by purchasing more of a selection to satisfy his local customers' needs.

loans.name: Mitaina

texts.en: Mitaina is 65 years old, from the village of Sataoa in Samoa. She used to be unemployed and mostly depended on her children for her daily needs. She joined a solidarity group organized by SPBD and took out her first loan of 750 tala (US$300) and started a small bakeshop. She bakes biscuits and cookies and delivers her goods to the different stores in the village. Her business has become so successful that she has already managed to export her biscuits to New Zealand and American Samoa (Pago Pago). Her new loan will enable her to improve her facilities and buy additional stock for producing biscuits.

loans.use: To upgrade existing oven and purchase additional ingredients for biscuits making

texts.en: Sirinbeyim M. lives in Agsu city and runs a small booth at the local bazaar selling clothing. She is married with four children. She has owned her business for three years. With this loan she hopes to expand her inventory by purchasing more stock.

Rahila M. lives in Agsu city where she has run a small booth in the local bazaar for the past eight years. She sells beauty supplies and small items for home use. She is 46 years old. Rahila wants to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu A. lives in Agsu city where he has owned a booth at the local bazaar selling household items for the past 10 years. He is married with three children. With this loan he wants to purchase more stock for his business and offer more variety.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to improve his business

loans.name: Alofisa

texts.en: Alofisa is a 45-year old lady from the village of Nuusuatia. She joined a solidarity group through SPBD four years ago and started a donut business. Every Sunday she would bake donuts which augmented her family income. After successfully paying off her first loan, she ventured into growing vegetables. Her second loan from SPBD enabled her to start a vegetable patch near her house. She was able to deliver vegetables twice a week and earn an additional US $100 per week. Her proposed loan will further enlarge her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, pesticides, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman H. lives in Agsu city where he owns a booth at the local bazaar selling women's clothing and shoes. He is 48 years old, married with five children. He has owned his store for 12 years. With this money he wishes to open up a second location at the bazaar selling food products.

loans.use: to open another business location selling food products

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil A. lives in Agsu city with his wife and two children. He owns a store at the local bazaar selling food products. He is 38 years old. With this loan he wants to purchase a refrigerator and other fixtures for his store.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his store

texts.en: Ilham A. owns a small butcher shop in the bazaar in Aghsu city. He has worked as a butcher for the past four years. With this loan he wants to purchase more animals in order to expand his business.

Nail O. lives in Agsu city where he owns a butcher shop at the local bazaar. He is 45 years old and is married with five children. With this loan he wants to purchase more animals and provide his customers with a wider choice as well.

Dargah is living in the Beylagan region and is engaged in the cattle breeding business. He sells livestock and also sells fresh meat. He has borrowed loans from Normicro Beylagan branch for a long time. His first loan was in the amount of $400. Now, his fifth time he applies for a loan and needs $1200 to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Judy would like to buy a high grade dairy cow

texts.en: Nurida is a resident of the Beylagan region. She started her private business in 2004 borrowing the first loan in  the amount of $500 from Normicro, Beylagan branch. For the first loan she increased the stock of goods and working capital. Now she needs a new counter-refrigerator to store meat and diary products.

Yegana S. lives in Agsu city and owns a small store where she sells food and household products. She is a 56-year-old widow with four children. With this loan she wants to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rebbecca would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif S. owns a small car wash off the main road that passes by Agsu city. He is 38 years old and married with four children. He has owned his business for the past six years. With this loan Vaqif wants to purchase better equipment for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his car wash

texts.en: Mashuga is  an IDP from the Fizuli region and now her family is living in Beylagan region. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $400 and bought one cow. She sells milk now. She is in need of new loans to increase the number of cows.

Ali is the resident of the Beylagan region. In 2004 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan of $400. He was engaged in cattle breeding and selling, a traditional business in rural areas. Now he is in need of a new loan to increase the number of livestock.

Dilruba is an IDP from occupied Lachin region. She settled in Beylagan region with her family in 1992. As traditionally they were engaged in cattle breeding she started this business in Beylagan. Her first loan from Normicro Beylagan branch was in the amount of $500. They buy cattle, breed them and sell to butchers. Now she needs $1100 to buy cattle and expand the business.

Teyar M. owns a small metal shop in  Qaraqasli village in the Agsu region. He is married. In his shop he practices the trade of his family for seven generations of making pots, pans, utensils, and other metal items for home and business use. With this loan Teyar wants to purchase equipment with better technology than what he is currently using.

Geray is a man from Yardimli district of Azerbaijan. He started his private business in 1998, and in 2005-2006 borrowed three loans for a total of $1100.  Now he wants to borrow 700$ to increase assortment of goods in his shop.

Vugar is local and lives in Beylagan town. In 2002 he started the business of selling home and kitchen items. Later he built a small store. He has borrowed several loans from Normicro Beylagan branch. The last loan was in amount of $900. Now Vugar is in need of $1200 to expand the business and to increase working capital.

Hidayat is 62 years old, married, has 4 children and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region.
He works hard for the success of his children. He likes to breed pedigree ewes.
Hidayat has had his business for 10 years and it allows him to support his family. He wants to offer  an education to all  his children that allows them to continue their own lives and to be an honest and hard-working people.
Now he needs a loan of $500 to buy 10 pedigree ewes.

Malakxanim Z. owns a small store in Agsu city where she sells food and other household products. She has owned this store for eight years. She is married with two children. Malakxanim wants to purchase more inventory as well as fixtures to improve the store.

Aybeniz is a resident of Beylagan town. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed her first loan of $400 and started the business of sheep breeding. The business went quite well and she took  out subsequent loans of $600 and $800. Now she wants to add more sheep to the herd and increase the income from the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a water tank

texts.en: Gulshan is an IDP from Kalbajar region who moved to Beylagan in 1992 as a result military conflict with Armenia. As with most of the IDPs it was very difficult to survive at first. To sustain the family  Gulshan started the traditional business of cattle breeding with her husband. She is long time client of Normicro Beylagan branch starting with her first loan in amount of $300. Now she needs $1000 to increase the number of livestock.

Novrasta came to Baku from the Qazax district of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2000. In 2005-2006 she borrowed a total of $1300. Now she wants to borrow 800$ to buy more materials for the business.

Aziza is an IDP from the Armenian occupied Fizuli region. Now her and her family resides in the Beylagan region. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan  of $500. She bought a milking cow and started selling milk and milk products. Now she wants to have two more cows to expand the business.

loans.name: Hikmet

texts.en:
This single man was born in 1978 in Khaladj village, Salyan region .
Hikmet has a small grocery store where he sells products. He has had his store for 10 years.
He requests a loan of $1000 to increase the variety of products he sells.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products

texts.en: Habil is a resident of Beylagan town. He started his private business in 2004. As most private businesses in town he began selling foodstuffs. As for the capital he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed four loans. Now he owns a food store and he needs new loan to increase the stock of goods and working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy a dairy cow and add 200 chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira is living in Baku city. She and her husband started their family business in 2000. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two loans from Normicro Baku branch, for a total amount of $1100. She used these loans for business expansion. Now she wants to borrow  an additional $700. This loan will mainly be used for increasing the variety of goods and increasing the volume of sales. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of materials she buys.

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en:
Maharram is a resident of Beylagan town. He has a small canteen in the town and also he is engaged in cattle breeding. He has his own supply of meat for the canteen. His business has developed 
considerably. He has borrowed four loans fron Normicro Beylagan branch, last for $600. Now he needs $1200 to increase the number of livestock.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Winnie would like to buy 2 high breed grade cows

loans.name: Ingilis

texts.en: Being an IDP, Ingilis settled in the Beylagan region. He decided to start a business to sustain the family and in 2003 he took out the first loan in for $400 from Normicro Beylagan branch. He is engaged in cattle breeding and selling. Now he wants $1100 to increase the number of livestock and to build a shed.

loans.use: To build a shed and increase livestock

texts.en: Ehtiram is an Internally Displaced Person from Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993, and started his business in 1996.  In 2005-2006 he borrowed two loans from Normicro Baku branch. The total amount he borrowed is $1,100. Now he wants to borrow $700 to increase the variety of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beatrice would like to buy 2 extra bales of  second hand clothes for her business

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin is the resident of Beylagan town. As with most people in rural areas, he is engaged in cattle and sheep breeding. Since 2004 he borrowed four loans from Normicro Beylagan branch. He uses the loans to increase his number of livestock. He has 25 sheep now and he wants to increase this number. For this he needs $1,200.

loans.use: To increase the size of his herd.

texts.en:
This single man is a very active and responsible. He has a plot of land where he grows fruits.
Ramil has been in this business for 6 years.
He was born in 1987 in Khaladj village, Salyan region. 
Ramil needs a loan of $600 to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to buy mobile phones accessories for her shop.

texts.en: Najaf is the resident of Beylagan. He owns a small blacksmith workshop where he makes iron gates, doors etc. He has run his business since 2004. He borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan branch; the last one amounting to $600. Now he needs $1,100 to buy raw materials for his business.

Jamala is a resident of Sumgayit city. She is single and 23 years old. Jamala lost both her parents during the war. She has grown up with many difficulties over the past 12 years. She started selling kitchen equipment, dishes and household appliances about four years ago. She is applying for a loan to expand her business by increasing the amount and variety of goods available for sale.

Samad is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin region and now resides in Beylagan. In 2003 he applied to the Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $300 and started  his cattle breeding in his native region. He breeds cows and sells milk. Now he wants to add more cows and expand his business.

Nazile is a low income person, originally from the Masalli district of Azerbaijan.She moved to Baku and started her business in 1998. During 2005-2006 she borrowed two times from the Normicro Baku branch a total of $2,100. Nazile wants to borrow $1,200 to increase the variety of her trade goods.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is a 28-year-old single man living in Sumgayit city. When he started his business two years ago he sold food items, but now sells household and kitchen items. Elshan is applying for a loan to increase the variety and amount of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his trade goods inventory.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahire is an Internally Displaced Person(IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli region. Now she lives in Beylagan Ashigly and her family is engaged in cattle breeding. She has borrowed four times from theNormicro Beylagan branch. The proceeds from these  loans were used to increase the number of livestock. Now Tahire needs $1,200 to further increase the size of her family's herd.

loans.use: To increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Rakhshanda

texts.en: Rakhshanda is an Internally Displaced Person(IDP) from the occupied Agdam district since 1993. She started her own business in 1998 using her own resources. During 2005-2006 she borrowed twice from the Normicro Baku branch a total of $2,100 and has expanded her business considerably. Now she would like to borrow $1,200 to increase the variety of goods and amount of trade goods in her store.

loans.use: To increase the variety and volume of goods for sale

texts.en: Vugar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Zangilan region of Azerbaijan. He is 34 years old and is married with three children. Vugar started his dental business eight years ago. The business is developing well and he is currently applying for a loan to buy dental equipment in order to increase the quality of service.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy hair chemicals and one dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman is the resident of Sumgayit town. She is 23 years old and now lives with her family in Sumgait city. She began her business 3 years ago, when she was 20 years old. In the beginning of hers business she sold bags. Khuraman has been renting the shoe shop, but she wants to borrow $1,200 to open her own shop and to increase range of goods for sale.

loans.use: To open her own shop and to increase the variety of goods

texts.en:
Nazila is 57, married,and has 4 children.She lives in  Khaladj village, Salyan region.  
She has her own poultry farm in the backyard of her house and she checks and attends the animals daily. 
Every day Nazila goes to the market and stores to offer her products. She has had her business for 15 years ago and it allows her to support her family.
Having borrowed $500 she bought 100 chickens. 
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 200 chickens.

loans.name: Nazime

texts.en: Nazima is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993 and started her own business in 1996. During 2005-2006 she borrowed two times from the Normicro Baku branch a total of $2,400. Nazima wants to borrow an additional $1,200 to expand the variety of trade goods in her shop.

loans.use: To increase the variety of trade goods inventory.

loans.name: Miri

texts.en: Miri is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Lachin region and now lives in Beylagan. After facing many hardships, he started the business of breeding and selling cattle. In order to accomplish this, Miri borrowed $400 from the Normicro Beylagan branch. Now he wants to increase the number of cows and to build a bigger shed.

loans.use: To increase the size of his herd build a shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Regina wants to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Logman

texts.en:
He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. Logman with his family settled in Sumgait city. He is 42. He is married, has 3 children. In the beginning of his business he sold glass and mirror in his own car. Having borrowed a loan amount of $600, he repaired his car, has bought the funitures from furniture plants and was sold in estates. The second loan $1000 he spent to built the small furniture store. 
Now Logman needs a loan amount of $1200 to expand his business area. He plans to open his own furniture salon.

loans.use: He plans to open his own furniture salon.

texts.en: Narmina is a low-income person, originally from the Shamakhi district of Azerbaijan. She now lives in Baku. She started her clothing business in 1999 with her own money. During 2005-2006 she borrowed two times from the Normicro Baku branch and used the process to expand her business considerably. Now Narmina would like to borrow an additional $1,200 to further develop her business in order to cover her family's expenses.

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara is a resident of Sumgayit. She is 29 years old and lives with her family and her five-year-old child in Sumgayit city. She rents a shop where she sells food products. Her business is quite new, having started it one year ago. Elnara is applying for a loan to increase the variety of goods in her store as well as to purchase scales for use in her shop.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods and to purchase scales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy more milk for her dairy business.

texts.en: Mahbuba is a low income person from Baku. She is married and has children. She started her own profitable business in 1997. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times a total of $1,500 from the Normicro Baku branch. Now she would like to borrow an additional $1,200 to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosalind would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en:
Shukur is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied Lachin region of Azerbaijan.  He now lives in Sumgait city. Shukur is 26 years old and been in the clothing business for 4 years.  He supports his family from this occupation. 
Now he needs a loan amount of $1,200 to open his own clothes store.

loans.use: To open his own clothes store

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.en: Tamasha is a hard working low-income woman. She initially established her tea-shop with a small amount of money.  Using the income from her small business and borrowing two times, a total of $2,200 from the Normicro Baku branch, Tamasha not only expanded her tea-shop business but also opened a new trading business. Now she needs $1,200 to expand her trading business and enhance her tea-shop facilities.

loans.use: To equip a new tea-shop and to expand  her trading business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a resident of Sumgayit city. Ali is 29 years old and has been in the business of selling clothes and other apparel items for the past year and a half. Ali supports his family with this business. He needs a loan to purchase more inventory in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by increasing his inventory

loans.name: Magsud

texts.en: Magsud is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan since 1993. In 1998 he started his business with his own meager resources. In 2005-2006 he borrowed two times from Normicro in the total amount of $2,000 and expanded his agricutural goods selling business considerably. Now he wants to borrow an additional $1,100 to expand his business further.

loans.use: To increase the variety of agricultural trade goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Caroline would like to open a beauty shop

texts.en: Elchin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Agdam region of Azerbaijan. He now lives in Sumgayit city. Elchin is 23 years old.  He has been in the business of selling clothing, bags, and other apparel products for the past five years. He is applying for a loan to increase his inventory.

Tabib is a Internally Displaced Person, originally from Tartar district of Azerbaijan. He now lives in  Lokbatan. He started his business in 1998. In 2005-2006 he borrowed two times from the Normicro Baku branch - total of $2,200.  He  would like to borrow $1,100 to increase his business more.

loans.name: Nukhbala

texts.en:
This single man was born in 1979 in Khaladj village, Salyan region .
4 years ago Nukhbala decided to start a small grocery store. This business does not provide him with income to cover household expenses.

Nukhbala needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of his store.

loans.use: To expand the area of his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah would like to buy a dairy cow.

texts.en: Ramil is a resident of Sumgayit city. He is 29 years old and married with one child. He began his business one year ago selling household items. Ramil is applying for a loan to expand his business by purchasing more inventory.

Ofelya lives in Beylagan. She borrowed $500 from  the Normicro Beylagan and started her business of sheep raising and sales. Now he wants a new loan in the amount of $1,100 to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly started his business in 1988. He operates an open-air shop. His beginning business capital was USD 108. He began with a stock of 50 pairs of shoes, but stopped the business in 2000 due to the political and economical instability in Kinshasa. 

Felly decided to resume his shoe business in 2004 and was informed by his friend about Hope’s loan program. He agreed to sign a loan contract with Hope. With his first Hope loan he stabilized his business by adding more pairs of shoes and diverse items such as boxes of batteries, small radios, shoe polish, padlocks, and other goods. Today, Felly has a stock of about 70 pairs of shoes. 

Felly has noticed that there is demand in his neighbourhood for women’s shoes also. With a loan of $600, Felly plans to diversify his business by adding women’s shoes and clothing. His long term plan is to move from an open-air shop to a shop indoors.

loans.use: Add women’s shoes and clothing items to stock

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

texts.en: Khalida is originally from Republic of Georgia; she has lived in Lokbatan since 1990. In 1995 she opened her family business with her own resources. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times from the Normicro Baku branch a total of $2,850 and has expanded her business considerably. Now she plans to borrow an additional $1,200 to expand her business further. Her husband is pictured here.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy different varieties of fruits and vegetables for her green grocer

texts.en: Alik is a resident of Sumgayit city. He is 25 years old and is not married. Alik is engaged in buying used cars, repairing them and re-selling them in a special car market. He has been doing this for almost three years. Alik applies to Normicro for his first loan with the purpose of increasing his working capital in order to develop his business further.

Maleyka is from the capital, Baku. She is married and has children. She started her business in 1995. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times a total of $1,300 from Normicro. Now she plans to borrow an additional $800 to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah would like to buy a dairy cow

texts.en:
This 37-year-old man lives in Khaladj village,Salyan region. He is married and has a child.

Ahadaga breeds calves in a private farm shed. He has been in this business for 4 years. With this business he meets the demands of his family. Through his business he has gained a great deal of knowledge and skills to expand his business.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.

Sovkat is originally from the Lerik district, in the Southern region of Azerbaijan. She is a low-income person, who is married, and has children. She opened her business in 1999 with her own money. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times from Normicro in the total amount of $1,400 and expanded her business. Now she wants to borrow an additional $1,000 to increase the variety of her inventory.

Tofig lives in Beylagan. He has been a client of the Normicro Beylagan branch since 2002, when he started his own business after getting his first loan in amount of $600. Subsequent loans in amount of $800 and $1,000 were used for the same purpose. Now he is in need of another loan to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy organic manures for her farm

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en:
Godelive began her business in 1980. She sells corn, flour, beans, rice, palm oil and other goods at her shop. Since receiving her first HOPE loan in 2004, Godelive has more than tripled her working capital. She has begun to save regularly and invests money back into her business. 

Godelive has recognized that there is a need for more suppliers connecting wholesalers to the retailers who sell the goods she sells. With a $1,000 loan, Godelive will build on the credibility she has developed in her community and become the supplier for goods coming from the wholesalers for her neighbourhood.

loans.use: Become a supplier between wholesalers and retail sales.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aide

texts.en: Aide is originally from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. In 1997 she started her clothing business. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times in the total amount of $1,400 from the Normicro Baku branch and expanded her business. Now she wants to borrow $1,000 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to increase her variety of goods

texts.en:
Shola is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. She has had her business for 5 years and it allows her to support her family.
Shola was born in 1969 in Khaladj village,Salyan region. She is married and has 2 children.
She supplies milk in the village at the nearby markets.
With this business she provides income and also provides milk for her family.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a milk cow.

Fatma is originally from Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan.
In 1998 she started her clothes trading business. In 2005-2006 she borrowed twice in the total amount of $1,400 from the Normicro Baku branch and expanded her business.
Now she wants to borrow $1,000 to expand her business.

Hajibaba is an Internally Displaced Person from the Kalbajar region and now lives in Ashigli in the Beylagan region. In 2003 he applied to the Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed his first loan in amount of $300. He bought sheep for this loan and started to trade them. He used subsequent loans in amount of $500 and $800 for the same purpose. He needs a new loan to expand the business more.

loans.name: Latafat

texts.en: Latafat is an Internally Displaced Person, originally from the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan. She moved to Baku in 1990. In 1999 she opened her salon. In 2005-2006 she borrowed 2 times in the total amount of from the Normicro Baku branch and expanded her business. Now she wants to borrow $1,000 to expand her business for the third time.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment to better serve her clients..

texts.en:
Ismayil is a 57-year-old well known welder in Yenikand village, Salyan region . He is married and has 4 children. He has been in this business for 10 years.
He needs a loan of $1200 to buy welding apparatus to satisfy his clientele. Ismayil is an honest and respectful man.

Rovshan is an Internally Displaced Person originally from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. In 2000 he started his own business. In 2005 he borrowed $500 from the Normicro Baku branch and expanded his business. Now he wants to borrow $700 to expand his business again.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy more business stock

loans.name: Namig

texts.en: Namig is originally from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. In 1995 he started his shop with a small amount of money. In 2006 he borrowed $1,650 from the Normicro Baku branch and expanded his business, Now he wants to borrow $1,200 to expand his business further.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and a repair box

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pais would like to buy six more steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sirote would like to buy more steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi would like to buy 5 steers

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en: Qabil H. owns an Auto Painting shop in the town of Khachmaz located in the Northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Qabil is looking for funding so that he can invest in a new paint sprayer.

loans.use: To purchase a new paint sprayer

texts.en: Eyvaz H. owns an upholstery shop in the town of Khachmaz located in the Northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Eyvaz wants to invest in new hardware that will enable him to perform complex work more efficiently.

Auntie Pat, as she is called by her customers, sells necklaces, earrings, body and hair pomades, artificial hair and so on. She lives in a community where women dominate and so daily demands for goods by individuals is very high. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to purchase more goods to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Mehr Afroz

texts.en:
Mehr Afroz is 52 years old and lives in a household of 10 in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Mehr Afroz took a 1st cycle loan for her oldest son who has a fuel and gas shop in the market.

Mehr Afroz is an uneducated woman, but she knows tailoring and embroidery well. Because of low family income she took a loan for her son to buy more fuel, gas and wood for his shop. If all goes well, she hopes to take a 2nd cycle loan for herself so she can start a tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy fuel, wood and gas

texts.en:
Amina was born in 1955. She lives in a household of 6 in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Amina took a 1st cycle loan so she could buy more materials for her medicines shop.

Her medicines shop is in a clinic near her house and here she sells medicine according to the doctors' prescription. She is very happy to be a good nurse for her people.

Amina works in medicine 7 days of the week to help people and empower her family financially as well.

Jamela was born in 1984. She lives in a  household of 5 in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Jamela took a 1st cycle loan for her husband Gulboden, who has property dealer shop in a large city.

Jamela is an educated women who teaches 3rd class grade in a school near her house, but because of financial problems she took a loan for her husband so that he can buy furniture and other materials for his shop. Right now, Jamela and her husband are very happy that she is able to cover the family financially.

M. Sarwar was born in 1962. He lives in a household of 6 in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

M. Sarwar has a shop in the market selling fabrics. He already passed the 1st, 2nd and 3rd cycle loan with positive repayment and now he is continuing with a 4th cycle loan. He has 6 years' experience in his current business. At the start of his business his shop had less fabrics, but after taking a loan through AFSG he bought lots more. Right now he is able to buy all kinds of fabrics and sell them in the bazaar. Through this process he is able to cover himself and his family financially.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a plot of land to grow cereal crops

texts.en:
Qand Agha is 32 years old and lives with his 4 children in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Qand Agha has a clothes shop in the market where he sells jeans, scarfs, jumpers, coats, t-shirts and trousers.

Qand Agha took a 4th cycle loan to buy those materials that he doesn’t already have in his shop. At the start of his business he didn't have too many customers because of less materials, so he faced lots of financial and family-related problems.

Right now with buying lots of materials for his shop, he is able to cover the expenses of both the shop and his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a fish processing and selling unit

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.en: "A good day's feed" is the motto behind Vitoria’s barbeque stand at Moamoa, which operates on a 4-day basis every week.  Financial assistance offered to her by SPBD helped set up the business. The initial $450 loan was used to buy meat (chicken, sausages, turkey tails) and taro for her stall.  Her husband also contributes financially to their family as he earns $100 fortnightly as a bus driver.  SPBD development programs and training assisted this family with knowledge, not only in financial assistance, but also with Victoria’s savings plan as she saves $10 each day from her business operation and $25 for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase barbeque stove, turkey tails, chicken, sausages, taro, and a pot; and cement, sand, timber, iron roof, and nails for the stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a plot of land to grow more horticultural plants

loans.name: Tanumia

texts.en: Tanumia of Maagiagi is an active member of one of the 162 village solidarity groups organized by SPBD. She is a fisherwoman.  With help from her husband, she manages their small fish stand. Monetary assistance from SPBD helped her to fish on Wednesdays and Saturdays. Their sales proved to be worthwhile as they earn $50 each day from selling their fish to the villagers. The income helped pay for school for their 2 smaller children, as well as and family and church obligations. By improving their fishing gear and nets, Tanumia hopes to earn more from her fishing enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and nets

loans.name: Rohane

texts.en:
Rohane was born in 1969 and lives in a household of 17 in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Rohane lost his left hand during the war and has had lots of financial problems since.

He decided to start a small business in the bazaar to solve his family problems. To start off with he bought socks and hats, then he took loans through AFSG to increase his business and buy more hats, socks and t-shirts, but because there are so many family members  this could not fulfill the family's financial needs. Therefore, he and his two brothers also have a second business that trades in the same products.

He hopes that by selling the products, slowly, he can improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: To buy hats, socks and T-Shirts

loans.name: Tailelei

texts.en: Tailelei runs a shop and delivers home-made chips (banana, taro). The shop is open 7 days a week and if it’s a good week the shop earns 200 tala (US$70). After making her loan payments and purchasing goods for her for her canteen, she has her real earning of 120 tala (US$40) weekly. Hard work and willingness to overcome problems and learning from past mistakes has made Talalelei’s business a fruitful one as the years go by.

loans.use: Purchase frying pan, gas stove, 10 sacks of taro, bananas, canned fish, soda

loans.name: Suifou

texts.en: Suifou, with financial assistance from SPBD, was able to put her sewing talents into commercial practice. The money helped her to buy the tools she needed like the sewing machine, thread, and all her sewing supplies. She is happy with the progress of her sewing shop as it makes her confident that she is able to provide for her family’s needs, especially in paying for her children’s education and other family commitments. "If you are looking for a seamstress, try Suifou’s Sewing Shop that provides you with all of the family's clothing at affordable rates," she would exhort her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of overlock sewing machine, cotton fabrics, and needles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acquire further training as a barber

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en: Sera and her husband share a talent for screen printing. They are raising 4 school-aged children, and are both employed. Her goal is for her children to get a good education that will benefit them in the long run. Sera was prompted to join the SPBD programme by the family's lack of money and other means of support. She decided to put her talent to good use with the help of her husband. Sera used her first loan to purchase plain materials, mostly lava (sarongs), screen-printed them, and sold them to individual shops. Because of the unique styles and beautiful colours, Sera’s business is booming - new orders are constantly being placed by her customers. She is now able to put her children through school and support her family financially. Sera is also looking to possibly expand her business by hiring 2 workers. And if she manages to save some extra money, Sera plans to expand her shop and even export her products to overseas markets. Currently, money is still a constraint, and she still has a long way to go. However, with the help of SPBD, Sera has already achieved her goal of being able to put her children through school.

loans.use: Purchase of paint, cotton materials, a screen, a brush, puletasi, and t-shirt materials

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara makes a living by making meat buns and selling them in her village. This small business operates 3 days a week (Tue/Wed/Thu). She prepares ninety meat buns daily, and sells them for 1 tala (US$0.30) each. After covering all of her expenses, Sara makes a weekly profit of 150 tala (US$50), and is happy to be able to support her family. She believes that others, too, can achieve their goals if they have faith in what they do, and in people and organizations whose help they seek.

loans.use: Purchase of a frying pot, flour, turkey tail, mutton flap, yeast, soy sauce, onion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a boutique that sews and sells garments

loans.name: Puao

texts.en: The SPBD’s outreach program has proven successful for Puao S., a business woman and one of the best known tailors in her village. Puao specializes in sewing puletasi, muumuu (dress) and men’s shirts. She also makes beautiful and unique elei prints for individuals and organizations like the Samoa Tourism Authority. Puao also receives requests from overseas clients, which acts as another stepping stone in expanding her business and providing more income for Puao and her family. She hopes to soon be able to make more money than the current 250 tala (US$80) weekly profit.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine, an overlock machine and fabrics

loans.name: Peka

texts.en: Peka operates a small grocery store where she sells foodstuffs, toiletries, etc. Peka has 3 children to support, two of which are already working and one helps her out in running the business. Compared to the time when Peka had just opened her grocery store, the financial burden has gradually lessened. Her shop is open 7 days a week, catering for the public for 15 hours straight. Peka's goal has been to improve her standard of living and to provide good education and access to proper health care for her children. With SPBD's assistance, she has achieved her goals. However, Peka continues to work hard in order to motivate not only her family, but also other less fortune and helpless unemployed women. Her good business sense and determination have made her successful, and currently Peka is able to make a weekly profit of 200 tala (USD$30). She plans to further expand her business, most probably by creating a supermarket that would offer a greater variety of goods than what she is supplying and selling now. Peka hopes to become financially independent and continue to be a great role model to the women who are unemployed and willing to improve their families' living standards. In particular, Peka offers them support and help in complying with the SPBD policies.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stocks, roofing and timber for her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a plot to grow fruit

loans.name: Peata

texts.en: Peata has joined the SPBD programme and has just been given a loan of 300 tala (US$100) to start a pork cake business. She is unemployed, married, and has 6 children. Her husband does not have a permanent job, and is not able to earn enough money to support their family. Peata's biggest worry has been the school fees for her 4 children attending school and other basic needs for her family. She opted for starting the business, because cakes are cheap to make, and because the business would not much interfere with her busy schedule as a full time mother. In addition, pork cakes are a favourite among the locals, especially children. To start out, Peata bought flour and meat, and now makes about 40 buns daily, 7 days a week. She sells the cakes to school children during the week and to other village people during the weekends. Occasionally, Peata's husband delivers the cakes to nearby shops.  She earns up to  280 tala (US$90) a week, and is now able to cover the family's basic needs in addition to paying her children’s school fees. Peata is even able to save some of the money to eventually increase the amount of cakes she supplies. In addition, she still manages to make loan payments on time, so that she can move up to the next loan level. Her determination to improve her family’s standard of living is making her work harder and learn to save with the help of SPBD's savings programme.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, turkey tail, mutton flap, soy sauce, salt, onion, sugar cooking utensils

loans.name: Fasialofa

texts.en: Fasialofa’s business is making German Buns (fried dough with coconut shavings in the middle) which she delivers to village schools and shops. With 6 children to look after (3 attending school,1 who works and 2 others still at home), Fasialofa has to work extra hard to help her husband who's the breadwinner of the family. Her husband’s earnings don't cover their expenses, so Fasialofa makes and sells German buns to help satisfy their daily necessities. She makes a profit of 120 tala (US$ 40) per week after all expenses. Now she’s able to budget and still save some in case of emergencies. She‘s looking at expanding her business into a bakery. Hopefully one day she will be financially independent and able to manage things on her own.

loans.use: Purchase of new kerosene stove, Flour, Sugar, Coconuts, Oil, Cooking Pot, Frying  Pan

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with three children. She runs a small business selling shoes and boots for men and women in one of the busiest city markets. Marina has been self-employed for 10 years and the business is now the sole means of support for her family. Her husband actively helps her by traveling to remote wholesale centers to purchase inventory. Marina is a determined hard-worker. She has experienced many challenges in her life. Her younger daughter had a spine fracture and was temporarily paralyzed. Fortunately, she recovered fully and is now doing well. Challenges have only strengthened Marina’s character. Her determination and strong will to succeed have helped to keep her business stable and sustainable and have promoted its expansion. Marina has received and paid back 10 different loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Presently, she has about $3,000 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $500. Marina would like to get a loan for $1,000 that will allow her to purchase 100 pairs of footwear for the spring season. She is planning to buy leather shoes for men and women that always sell well in the spring. Income from the sale of these shoes will be put towards some family expenses. Marina would like to invest generated profits into her eldest daughter’s hairdressing business – making her entrepreneurial dreams come true. She believes that her first priority as a mother and successful business owner is to help her daughter find her business focus, set a good strategy and see her own startup succeed.

Марина – одружена, в неї троє дітей. Вона займається бізнесом з продажу чоловічого та жіночого взуття та чобіт. Працює вона на одному з найбільших місцевих ринків. Марина займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років, торгівля є єдиним джерелом прибутку для родини. Її чоловік активно допомагає з бізнесом, їздить на оптові бази, де закупає товар за помірними цінами для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Марина – наполеглива та працьовита. Вона пройшла багато випробувань. Декілька років тому її дочка отримала перелом хребта, деякий час залишалася паралізованою. На щастя, вона повністю одужала і зараз почуває себе чудово. Випробування тільки загартували характер Марини. Її наполегливість та сила волі допомогли їй зберегти стабільність бізнесу та сприяли його розвитку. Марина отримала та вчасно сплатила усі 10 позик від „Надії України”. Зараз в товар в неї вкладено приблизно 3000 доларів. Чистий місячний прибуток складає 500 доларів. Марина хотіла б отримати позику в 1000 доларів, яка дозволить їй закупити 100 пар взуття напередодні весни. Вона планує придбати шкіряне чоловіче та жіноче взуття, яке завжди користується попитом. Марина планує витратити прибуток від продажу взуття на потреби родини. Вона хотіла б вкласти отриманий прибуток в бізнес своєї старшої доньки, яка тримає власну перукарню. Фінансова підтримка допоможе їй втілити в життя мрії доньки. Вона вважає, що найголовніше для неї, як матері та успішного підприємця – допомогти донці знайти власну нішу в бізнесі, розробити стратегію та відкрити власну справу.

loans.use: To purchase 100 pairs of shoes for spring season

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan runs a small business, selling food products in Melitopol’s busy central market. He is married with two children. After school he was not able find a good paying job so he decided to go into business for himself. He has now been self-employed in grocery sales for 10 years and is the sole breadwinner for his family. Ivan is very determined and serious about his business. These characteristics have helped him promptly repay 5 loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Maintaining a reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in Ivan’s work and have ensured the success of his business. Presently, he has about $2,000 of working capital and a monthly net profit of $700. Ivan is asking for a loan of $500 to increase his assortment of food products. He is hoping to use the extra financial support to stock up on more groceries, such as dairy products, mayonnaise, coffee, tea, and canned vegetables. The loan will not only be beneficial for Ivan’s business as it will promote its expansion, but it will also help him meet his household expenses and set aside some savings for future needs.

Іван – власник бізнесу з продажу товарів харчування на центральному ринку міста Мелітополь. Він – одружений, має двох дітей. Після школи Іван не міг знайти гарно оплачувану роботу. Отже, він вирішив зайнятися власним бізнесом. Іван працює в сфері продовольчих товарів вже 10 років. Його бізнес – єдине джерело прибутку для родини. Іван – дуже цілеспрямований та серйозний. Ці якості допомогли йому вчасно сплатити усі 5 позик, які він отримав від „Надії України”. Розумна цінова політика та ввічливе обслуговування завжди були важливими в роботі Івана та забезпечили успіх його бізнесу. Зараз, в товарі в нього приблизно 2000 доларів, щомісячний прибуток складає 700 доларів. Іван просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент продовольчих товарів. Він сподівається використати додаткову фінансову підтримку для того, щоб закупити більше товарів харчування, а саме, молочних продуктів, майонезу, кави, чаю та консервованих овочів. Позика не тільки сприятиме розвитку бізнесу Івана, але й допоможе йому задовольнити усі потреби його родини та заощадити кошти на інші потреби.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a lorry to deliver vegetables

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married and has two grown children. He runs a small business selling curtain fabric which is the only source of income for his family. Yuryi has been in this business for 13 years. He owns a pavilion in the local market and rents retail space in one of the local malls. His wife is actively involved, helping him with sales. Yuryi is a very dynamic person and his experience in this field is exemplary. He first became a client of “Nadiya Ukraine” in 2002 and has promptly repaid every loan he has received. In that time his business has seen considerable growth. Yuryi has been able to open a new vending kiosk in a local mall, and hire an employee to help him with sales. Currently, his business does about $3,000 in monthly gross revenue. Yuryi is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase 8 rolls of curtain fabric which cost between $50 and $500 per roll. He is able to purchase assorted types of curtain fabrics at wholesale prices for further retail sale. He is also planning to hire a second salesperson soon which will provide a stable source of income for one more family in the community. Yuryi believes that this loan will help boost his economic activity and allow him to generate more profits. It will not only help him grow his business, but will also provide better a quality of life for he, his wife, and his employees.

Юрій – одружений, в нього двоє дорослих дітей. Він займається бізнесом з продажу гардинно-тюлевих тканин, який є єдиним джерелом прибутку для його родини. Юрій займається цим бізнесом вже 13 років. Він – власник павільйону на одному з місцевих ринків, а також він орендує торгівельне приміщення в одному з місцевих універмагів. Дружина Юрія активно допомагає йому з торгівлею. Юрій – дуже динамічна людина, його багатий досвід роботи вартий наслідування. Він став клієнтом „Надії України” в 2002 році, вчасно сплатив усі позики. Завдяки фінансовій підтримці його бізнес значно розширився. Юрій зміг орендувати приміщення в одному з місцевих універмагів, взяв на роботу ще одного реалізатора. Зараз місячний валовий прибуток Юрія складає приблизно 3000 доларів. Юрій просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати 8 рулонів гардинно-тюлевих тканин, кожен з яких коштує приблизно 50 - 500 доларів. Він хоче закупити різноманітні тканини оптом для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Він також планує взяти на роботу ще одного реалізатора, що забезпечить стабільний прибуток для ще однієї родини. Юрій вважає, що позика сприятиме покращенню його економічного становища та допоможе йому отримати додаткові кошти. Фінансова підтримка не тільки сприятиме росту його бізнесу, але й забезпечить кращий рівень життя для нього, його дружини та співробітників.

loans.use: To purchase 8 rolls of curtain fabric

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married with a grown son. She supports the essential needs of her household by running a small business selling tea and coffee in a busy city market. Currently, Nina has over $3,000 of working capital in her business and her monthly net profit amounts to $1,000. Nina is very patient and polite. Her commitment to good business and her natural friendliness attract many potential clients. A variety of quality teas and coffees also makes her kiosk a popular stop for passing customers. Not long ago Nina faced big challenges due to the reconstruction of the local market where she had a kiosk. However, these difficulties didn’t stop her. On the contrary, Nina continued to work hard investing her time and efforts in the growth of her business. Today she owns two kiosks and her business is continuously expanding. Nina is requesting a loan of $1,200 to help open a new kiosk in the market and to allow her to purchase additional tea and coffee from wholesalers where she can get a good price. This loan will help to significantly boost Nina’s revenue and grow her business, further improving the quality of life for her and her family.

Ніна – одружена, в неї дорослий син. Забезпечувати основні потреби родини їй допомагає власний бізнес з продажу чаю та кави. Ніна працює на одному з місцевих ринків. Зараз загальна сума в товарі у неї складає більше 3000 доларів. Розмір чистого прибутку досягає 1000 доларів. Ніна – дуже терпляча та ввічлива. Її відданість власній справі та природна привітність приваблюють багато потенційних покупців. Розмаїття якісного чаю та кави притягують увагу перехожих на ринку. Нещодавно Ніна стикнулася з певними труднощами, пов’язаними з реконструкцією місцевого ринку, де був розташований її кіоск. Однак, ці випробування не зупинили її. Навпаки, Ніна продовжувала наполегливо працювати, вкладаючи час та гроші в розвиток власного бізнесу. Зараз вона володіє двома кіосками, її бізнес поступово зростає. Ніна просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб відкрити новий кіоск на ринку. Вона планує закупити додаткову партію чаю та кави оптом за помірними цінами. Позика значно підвищить прибутки Ніни та сприятиме подальшому розвитку її бізнесу, що, в свою чергу, якісно покращить життя її родини.

loans.use: To open a new kiosk in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more goods and fully stock his shop

texts.en: Fuad is the resident of Beylagan region. He decided to establish his own business and in 2005 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch. He borrowed his first loan in amount of $700,  and opened an internet cafe. First he put billiard tables and now he is in need of another loan to buy two computers and run Internet.

Ramiz was born in 1952 in Yenikand village, Salyan region. He is married and has 4 children. He has been running this business for 5 years.
He enjoys looking after fruit trees. He plans to create a new orchard.
He requests a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and seedlings. He wants to increase the variety of fruit trees.

Shakir likes animals. All in Khaladj village know him and buy sheep from him.
He needs a loan of $1000 to buy pedigree ewes.
He is 48, married, has 2 children. This man is 
very optimistic about the future of his business.

Eldaniz is the resident of Beylagan town. in 2002 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch, borrowed $300, rented a car and started to work as taxi driver. Subsequently he borrowed $500 and $800, expanded his business and bought the rented car. Now he wants to sell the old car and buy new one.

Shikhali breeds calves and  cows in a private farm shed.
He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had his business for 10 years and it allows him to support his family.
He needs a loan of $1000 to open a butcher shop. He has a lot of customers because his meat is always fresh and delicious. He cleans and feeds the calves and cows himself.
This single man lives in Khaladj village,
Salyan region.

Hasena is 32 years old and lives with her 5 children in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Hasena shares a business with her two sons and one daughter, weaving carpets at home. She has 6 years' experience in the current business.

Hasena took a 1st loan cycle to buy thread and other materials. Before she had problems with a lack of materials.

Hasena is an uneducated women but she wants her children to be educated. Therefore her children are only working part time.

48-year- old Pakiza lives in Khaladj village,Salyan region. She is married and has 3 children.
She goes to the market and stores to offer her products. 
She has a steady stream of clients and places to exhibit her sheep. She also delivers them.

Yalchin is the resident of Beylagan town. He is the client of Normicro Beylagan branch since 2001. He is engaged in food stuff sales. First he borrowed $400 then $600 and then $800. He used the loans to increase the working capital. Now he wants to buy a counter refregerator.

loans.name: Afet

texts.en: Afet is a resident of Beylagan town. She is engaged in fruit and vegetable sales. At first she borrowed $600 from Normicro Beylagan branch and increased the stock of goods. Next she borrowed $800 for the same purpose. Now she needs new loan again for the same purpose.

loans.use: To increse the variety of goods

texts.en:
3 years ago Anar decided to open his cafe.He has many regular clients. His cafe is very small.
Anar is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region, settled in  Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children.
This 29-year old man is a very good kabob-maker. You can see in the picture a woman, who is his worker.
Having borrowed a loan of $500 he bought an oven and a stove.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy additional equipment to maintain his cafe.

Yagut is a resident of Beylagan region. In 2002 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $400. For this loan she rented a building and started sales of pharmaceutical goods. Subsequent loans in amount of $600$ and $800 were used for the same purpose. She needs new loans to increase the variety of goods.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa is is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in  the Absheron region. He is married and has 2 children.
The first time 41-year old Isa borrowed $400 and bought 2 wheels.
Now he requests a loan of $800 to buy 4 wheels. He has been running this business for 5 years.
Isa has rented this truck.

loans.use: To buy 4 wheels for his concrete truck

texts.en: Eldar is the resident of Beylagan town. He is engaged in butchery and he is the client of Normicro Beylagan branch since 2004. He started his business long ago getting loans. After borrowing funds from Normicro he considerable expanded the business. He also trades livestock. He needs new loan to expand the business more.

loans.name: Tavad

texts.en: Tavad is the resident of Beylagan town. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed the first loan in amount of $500 and started her own business of trading small household items. She borrowed next loan in amount of $700 and expanded the business. She is in need of new loan to increase the variety of goods and develop the business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

texts.en:
Azer works in exchange. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Khodjali region. He has settled in  Khirdalan settlement, is married and has 2 children.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $300 to buy apparatus for counting money.
The second loan of $600 he spent to do capital repairs in his office.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy additional apparatus. 
Azer has run this business for 5 years.

loans.name: Malahat

texts.en: Malahat is the resident of Beylagan town. She is a local msrket retailer. She sells clothing. In 2006 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed the first loan in amount of $600 and used it for rental of the place in the market and to increase the stock of goods. This helped her to increase the volume of the business. Now she applies for the second loan to increase the variety of clothing.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

texts.en:
Vagif was born in  1951 in Yenikand village,Salyan region. He is married and has 3 children.
Vagif has run this business for 6 years.
He supplies milk in the village and nearby markets.With this business he meets he needs of his family.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 3 calves.

loans.name: Jahid

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane Wangari, aged 50 years, is recently widowed, having lost her husband in January 2007. She has two children and two grand-children, who all depend on her, because her children are only able to get casual jobs once in a while. Jane sells cooked foods, within the Kiambiu slums, including beans, black beans and githeri, a mixture of maize and beans boiled together.

Jane previously had an embroidery business which collapsed after one of her sons was involved in a road accident, where she spent all she had including business money on his medical expenses. This son eventually died, leaving Jane and her other children absolutely poor. Jane had previously borrowed some money from one of the big Micro-finance institutions in Kenya, to enable her to run this business. Due to the medical problem in the family, she was unable to continue with the loan repayments, hence could not borrow again, since she was now viewed as a risky client.  

Jane started off her current business in early 2006, after she borrowed a tin of beans from a businessman, who allowed her to cook and sell the beans, then later make the payments for the borrowed tin of beans.  From the same proceeds, she managed to buy her first tin of beans, which she continued to cook, hence setting up the business. Jane is now a member of the Vumilia group of Action Now Kenya, in the Kiambiu slums, where she has so far accessed two levels of loans, of Usd. 57 and Usd. 85, both of which she used to increase her stock, and which she has since repaid successfully. 

Currently Jane has only one sufuria (cooking pot) of her own, while the other two she has are borrowed, and the owner has actually been asking her to return them. Jane therefore seeks to buy two sufurias of a bigger size than what she is currently using, together with two jikos (cooking stoves) big enough for the pots she will buy. The biggest benefit to Jane will be that she will be able to return the borrowed pots, and also acquire bigger pots that will enable her to make more food, as is required by her customers. She also intends to introduce the sale of boiled green maize (corn) and green grams, which her customers have been requesting her to make.

As part of goodwill, Jane reserves the bean stock she gets from the boiled beans and githeri, to give to some of the women within the Kiambiu slums, who are too poor to buy food. They use this stock to make a stew for the family meal, hence their children don’t have to sleep hungry as long as Jane is there. 

A loan of $75 which will be given to her in kind (i.e ANK will purchase the two pots and cooking stoves for her), will assist her not only to achieve her objective of preparing more food, but will also enable her to have more stock to serve to more people in need. The repayment period for this loan will be between 4 – 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sufurias (cooking pots) and 2 jikos (inexpensive cooking stoves)
